text: meh..great graphics, buggy as hell. lose an overlay, have to restart. make a mistake, have to restart. great concept done in a very badly designed way. late game is very laggy. traffic and economic rules don't make any sense, this game is light years better than most of the other city building sims, but still light years from a fun, latest generation city builder. i rate it a out of .

bloodlust shadowhunter is so unremarkable that i honestly find it difficult to properly review. like, okay, it's almost entirely the work of one man i understand that completely. in some ways, i'm even genuinely impressed, its visuals, atmosphere and overall concept all commendable under the circumstances. the audio work? amateur at best, on par with a high school mixing lab project in a world where competent bedroom producers are a click away, there's no reason not to aim for better. now that's not to say this wouldn't be reasonably excusable if the gameplay was of any worth, but in this case, it most certainly isn't. honestly, i'd go so far as to consider the gameplay botched beyond belief, by far the most damning of all flaws, painfully slow, janky controls and borderline broken a.i. entirely baffling in their sheer levels of ineptitude. is what ruins bloodlust shadowhunter in its entirety, the proverbial fate-sealing nail on the coffin. long story short -- stick with vampire the masquerade - bloodlines a buggy mess, sure, but infinitely more enjoyable in comparison.

killing floor is one of those games that never gets old no matter how many times you play it. it's addicting, tense espiscelly with the hell on earth difficulty , action-packed, pretty good fps, and you gotta love that terrible yet tolerable voice acting. the only downside is the amount of servers there is anymore. in - there would be up to servers, but now all i can get is at the highest, shame to see such a great game lose its playerbase in that amount of time, but i digress. so basically, buy the game now before everyone's gone.

i wanted to like this game but it just does everything it can to become tedious and boring. the combat is as generic as it gets, with you constantly bashing just one button because it's actually more efficient than using any of your skills. quests are also terrible as you have to kill rabbits or bats, collect some flowers while running around in a huge landscape filled with the same stupid bandits, goblins and wolves which you have to fight because running away from them is almost impossible as you have barely have any stamina. the fact that the fast travel is restricted to cities and a few crystals you find trhoughout the game is also frustrating as you have to spend most of your time running around empty ladscapes.

very fun gameplay is involved with this new batman offering. the fear takedowns are pretty awesome, as well as the batmobile gameplay. the ui is also more streamlined to match the new suit. i will say that the graphics are rather dated and washed out. the performance issues are present, as well, so take caution before buying. my build includes i k, msi gaming mobo, gb of ram, and a titan x. on p, i'm getting a pretty consistent fps, after unlocking the frame rate. i would suggest currently purchase only with either a titan x, fury x, sli, or sli for these performance numbers. if you keep it locked down at fps, you might be alright with a single , , or x.

the disappointment of the last decade for me! project cars was meant to be the ultimate simulation. the physics of rfactor , the laserscanned tracks of iracing plus their great online community and partly realistic graphics. first apart from the graphics they reached none of their goals. they said real racing drivers helped them to develop the physics but i, as a guy who has driven a formula renault . car, can say that it is sht, the cars have way too much grip and are way too forgiving. for example you can brake almost mtr. later than in real life but you just lock up and understeer of the racing line if you turn in but you do not spin and still get a decent line to overtake. so i think this game is even worse than the good old shift in my opinion because we are years on now and the handling has not improved in the slightest only the graphics are good

i stopped buying ubi games for a reason, but decided against my better judgement to give this a shot. i will never buy ubi again. ubisoft proves it still hates customers. servers were down day one on launch and they didn't even have the balls to compensate for the down time, nor to even let people know what was going. they grab your money and disappear. also, you can t even go prone or duck in this game. this is an fps and you can't even do basic movement. since this game was made for consoles and is just ported to pc there is the ability to have an aim assist. there is litterally an aim bot built into this game. any form of skilled pvp is imposibble. you can't even enter all the buildings surrounding you. it's literally just a corridor shooter, not an open world in any form. character customization is a joke. you have such limited options i have no idea why they even added it to the game. and the characters you can chose from are just horrific looking. the artists for this game need to commit suicide. skip this trash.

i wonder if they actualy even thoughtfully tested thier game before releasing it. because the physics feel wonky. the geometry, lightning and textures is offen broken. alot of clipping, models 'see through area' exposed, inconsistent texture quality lightning killed by a spinning blades on that was on the other side some bars. nice. lightning guard's just suddenly jumping through the wall to steal my precious guns. killed by a fire jet that i thought already was safe to run over. lovely. no, i didn't run into it getting my nuts roasted to a crisp, but apperantly that one little part of the sprite that was pretty much gone apperantly was enough. hearing 'this baby could put a smile on anybodys face' for the th time isn't funny yes i know you can mute it but what about the other lines that don't play so offen and the list goes on. i mean it's definitly fun playing. but consistently experiencing these bugs and other flaws really just takes away most of it. it's worth giving it a shot if it's really cheap on a sale. otherwise don't waste . on this.

a free-to-play gem of a little visual novel that shouldn't be overlooked. it's a short but bittersweet story, with breaktakingly beautiful art. while the story is tragic, it's still got an incredble underlying message that is highly inspirational. this would make a great introduction to the visual novel genre for a first-timer, as well. i would love to see more from the developer of this game, they have great potential to create wonderfully elegant stories and memorable characters.

this game is amazing in every way. for one, they threw in interesting and informative historical facts about wwi as the story progressed, which i found very cool. the story is compelling, the characters feel real, the music is beautiful, and the landscapes and backgrounds look great. once i started this game i played straight through, i just couldn't stop. and games don't usually get to me emotionally, but by the time this one ended, it was all kinds of dusty in my room. i found this game to be extremely immersive, and one of the best buys i have made from steam. i highly recommend it to everyone.

very difficult to install - takes too long, a lot of changes from rome which means a longer learning curve, taking away the fun of playing easy, fast moving games. i suppose the developers expected all of us to spend all our time learning and playing this game, which is not possible especially if you are otherwise gainfully employed. good graphics but limited scope for enjoyment since the game is so unwieldy. i have also experienced a lot of crashes, so obviously game engine robustness is an issue. once i get some time i will write to ca with my issues and hope they can fix them. i've hardly played a few hours and i am already feeling the strain of crashes and reinstallations of a very unwieldy and overdone game. looks to me like certain sections of code need some drastic rewriting to cut some fat from it. maybe some of the in-game complexities can be removed. i feel like a good patch can fix this. i wouldn't recommend this game to a newbie. stick to empire, which is a far more robust game.

nice visual novel for one single playthrough. i was excited about wooing other characters after i made sam my loyal pardner in crime but the excitement and my boner wasn't worth it. your neck always ends up being ravished by every male character. the sex scenes and the lines stay the same. the only things that change are the names and the cg you just read over and over through the same text. true, it was interesting in the first playthrough but then the writer became so lazy about writing different scenes and different lines for every character it almost made me drop a tear of disappointment. the writing and the voice acting was good malix and diana rock my socks off all this hard work felt a bit wasted. every character should be unique it their own way. unfortunately it felt as if they're clone stormtroopers. the bloopers are the only thing i enjoyed from beginning to end. great job at voice acting.

don't waste your money on the pc version. the game does not save. they've known about this problem for over a year and haven't patched it yet, and on the forums there's a sticky that just says they know about it, with no advice on how to fix it. this means the game is almost completely unplayable. you would have to beat the whole thing all in one shot to make it through. do not waste your money on this game.

machinarium is a really charming game. between the music, visual designs, and incredibly challenging puzzles, you can tell that the designers put all of their heart into this game. and i found myself putting a lot of heart into the protag robot the game is so charming that even though it's a very simple 'rescue your princess' story, it's just so much deeper than that. i loved this game. i just wish it could have been longer i managed to beat this game in two sittings. but here's the thing it didn't seem like . hours played. it seemed like i just flew through it because i was enjoying myself the entire time, even when i was stumped by puzzles. and if that's not the mark of a good game, then i don't know what is.

unless you really miss 's adventure games and can sympathise with a sociopathic, obnoxious of a protagonist you probably shouldn't play this. lovely art style though, just incredibly tedious gameplay that often leaves you directionless so you end up wandering from screen to screen desperately clicking on absolutely everything in an effort to advance.

battleborn is a good game. maybe even a great game. it has that fun quirky style and humor of borderlands, with fun and inventive characters. but there is a huge flaw in this game. imagine, you work really hard and muscle up dollars to get deluxe edition. you have lots of fun and enjoy it, but they have an update where they try to make you spend even more money for useless skins that have no effect on gameplay. dollars for a taunt and basically dollars for a skin! if the game was free to play i could understand that but it is not. seeing that they are so money hungry truly disgusts me. i used to defend this game and praise it. but now i have not played since the update. to those of whom wish to get battleborn, don't. while it may be fun, you should not condone such behavior. in my opinion micro-transactions are ruining games these days. in short while it maybe fun, do not get battleborn.

'yeah! lightsabers!' you think for about ten seconds. then you start playing and see how dull and easy to cheese it is, while at the same time being unfair by ramping up the difficulty artificially just faster shots instead of more variety . there's not enough there to justify the price. i will come back to it later if there is more to do, and in a better way.

i'll give loadout credit where credit is due, it's pretty fast paced action for a third person arena shooter. the multitude of problems i experienced on launch were hard to overcome but i do understand that launches can be harsh on developers. down to the nitty gritty. you pretty much have to grind matches to get any of the 'good' weapon combinations as you start off with very little 'blutes'. i've never been a fan of grinding in any shooter. on top of that, everyone looks exactly the same. this is because the money making methods from loadout are all through skins. these are paid for in gold, which is different to blutes and can only be 'earned' by buying them for real money and the skins are a lot of money, even when compared to another f p game such as lol. if this was a paid game with all content included instead of f p with microtransations, then i would recommend it in a heartbeat, but i cannot in its current state.

highly recommended, gameplay is nothing too special but the phenomenal story and superb characters make up for this and then some. i would also suggest picking up burial at sea while you are at it to get the complete story. the game is worth every penny, honestly would not of even minded paying full price for this.

i don't really have much to add that other people haven't said already. the mouse smoothing is so bad that if i move my mouse slowly the cursor will just jitter a little to the left. or the right, or up, or down. but no diagonals, if i try to move the cursor in a slow diagonal then it just doesn't move at all. if i move the mouse faster then i can do diagonals too, but the mouse acceleration is so bad that it just ends up right in the corner of the screen. this is all with reducemouselag and doublebuffermouselag both set to false, and mouseaccelthreshold set to in the ini's.

this is a cool game and it deserves some of your time. one of the best soundtracks collection of metal music i've heard. frequently over-the-top characters, scenery, and gameplay concepts. gameplay controls are nicely tweaked to not be annoying, but not be hand-holding either, leaving you free to drive around, kick bad guys butts, and enjoy the story without them getting in the way and causing frustration. has a satisfying conclusion that's worth making it to. parents - gore can be turned off and objectionable language bleeping is also an option.

if you want to run a hospital get theme hospital instead. this game is very similar with less controls. with th you get to increase pay wages and control heating and money spent on researching cures and some random challenges within the game mode. this game has zero controls involved. all you get to do is build rooms, hire fire staff and decorate the hospital and nothing else. i would prefer a hospital game where i can control staff hours, wages, the types of tasks they can perform, break times, charges for each treatment per doctor. i would also make it more realistic and include plastic surgery and post surgery recovery time spent in the hospital bed. throw in a cafe, job posting where i can list tasks, work schedule and skill requirements just to add more to the game. if this game is offered to you for free then take it but don't waste the money on this game. you won't play it very much.

this game's all over the place. story is a mess, though it's not hard to tell what's happening. absolutely beautiful, no matter what haters say about id tech . gameplay seems good at first, with a great open starting area allowing you multiple approaches to get through it. but then the rest of the game turns into a linear shooter with insta-kill puzzle areas and mini-bosses that quickly becomes tedious. i hope the developer gets another shot at an evil within to get it right, because lots of potential here, but save your money for a sale.

too short of a game to be worth . it is beautiful and has an alright story. this is mostly a puzzle game and due to it being so short, does not get boring quickly. if you are bad at everything ever like myself, you will die, a lot. this game's controls get you killed a lot if you spam them and you will also die a lot due to the fact that is the only way to figure out some of the puzzles. you could probably beat the game before the hour refund period is even up if you push yourself hard enough to do it. the game gets infuriating at times but it is understandable usually. the collectables are very easy to find as well. the combat system is boring and most of the time you will find yourself running from fights more than actually fighting which is not a bad thing but you normally cannot fight even if you wanted to. i would recommend if it was cheaper, such as . or below, but there are much better games to spend your money on which can give you a lot more enjoyment and time to kill.

firewatch is a very enjoyable wilderness exploration game with a beautiful art style and soundtrack ! it features two likeable, realistic characters whose very real dialogue serves as a delightful centerpiece to this game. the relationship that forms between henry and delilah is artful, funny, and personal. firewatch is a touching story that draws you in and doesn't let go until your whole afternoon is gone! took me close to six hours to complete the first time, without hiking around my section of the park and exploring as thoroughly as perhaps i could have. i absolutely love this game! i will be playing through it again soon, just to choose different dialogue options and laugh-out-loud all over again! . out of

so basically there are two types of video game franchises there's the type which you need to play every single game to get the full story optimal experience, like half-life, or hotline miami. then there's the type in which every game is basically the same in plot gameplay, and you only need the most recent or most highly-rated game, like cod or assassin's creed. this game falls under the second category. it's pretty ok, but fallout is going to be a vastly superior experience, and fallout new vegas was pretty good, so i'd skip this if i were you. i like the open world and the cool side quests, and plot, but the graphics are out of date the latest half-life game came out a year earlier but it looks so much better , the gameplay could use work, and the weapons just have no 'oomph' to them. compare it to wolfenstein the new order. that game has some real badass weapons, you'll see what i'm talking about.

great little sequel to banner saga. they've certainly tidied up game-play, and made it easier to keep organized, and level your units. most of the kinks have been ironed out, but there still were some frustrating times, like having to retake a conversation because you died in battle, or having to load a save file only to have to take the cutscene no skipping non-animated cutscenes , all over again. there was a little bit of imbalance when it came to controlling the two different parties for instance, items were hard to come by with your second party. in terms of story, it was amazing, and beautiful as always, but it ended extremely quickly, and the last boss fight in polar opposite to the first game , was far, far too easy. out of

wonderful version of one of the greatest games ever. the graphics have been masterfully remastered, including subpixel scrolling for an ultra-smooth experience. the voices have been re-sampled from the original dat recordings and are crystal clear. you can switch between the original presentation and the remastered one anywhere with a single keypress. technically this version is perfect. if forced to critique anything about the game, it would have to be the subtitle sync which seems slightly off, with longer sentences staying on screen long after they've been uttered. a subtitle speed slider would solve this. highly recommended.

as you can guess by the obscure sources combed for positive reviews on the game's main page, hydrophobia is almost comically bad. the game combines dodgy controls, overambitious promises the signature ability to control water? it's unlocked at the very end of the game , cartoonishly evil villains, and inconsistent voiceacting with a setting and plot interesting enough to keep you playing. i would recommend this game to anyone studying video game design, as it is a comprehensive guide on what to avoid.

hell yeah isn't great, but it isn't terrible either. it's a mix of both. let me explain the humor is hit and miss - at times it's genuinely funny, at times it's extremely childish. you could say it's for both kids and adults, but in my opinion that's nonsense and it just isn't consistent. platforming and killing is the heart and soul of this game. it performs well in the killing aspect, especially the finishing mini-game moves, and not too bad in the platforming aspect, but the controls take some time getting used to and the platforming is at times very imprecise, which results in you falling off ledges regularly. and i really disliked the backtracking, even if it's for short distances. this is no metroidvania game. backtracking in this game is an artificial way to extend the game and it's highly unneccesary if you ask me. it is already packed with content so there's plenty of other stuff to do. seriously, if i had the chance to buy this game again i would've waited for a discount. rating out of

i played warface for a few hours and figured it was a decent game. once i played longer and longer, i realized the game is horribly unbalanced. one of the snipers is a one-shot kill no matter if it's in the head or the legs which enables players to sit in the back of the map or around your spawn and spray shots like it's nothing. also, there is a claymore in every building planted by the opposing team. i have discovered that this game isn't really based on skill but which weapons you have and if you are sitting in a corner or not. i had high hopes of this game as the graphics are quite decent and maps are built well but the overpowered weapons and irritable players make this game broken.

i have a driver's license. a real one. in game, i can pilot f cars with such ease as i can parallel-park a truck. i can flee a v cop car with only my hands. but this game is not a parking simulator. this is more like a challenge. it sits there on my library, teasing me for quitting on the fourth level. the game is.. cute.. not much more than that. the controls are unusual, to say the least. although you can setup many keys, you'll only need your mouse and the w up key. steering is done by clicking the wheel and turning it, while throttle is w. that is not unexpected, since this is a port of a mobile game. for a mobile game, it might 've been something cool to pass time, but not as a steam game, with bad ported controls.. if this game accepted either controller inputs or allowed to steer using a d right left, maybe, just maybe this would pass as a real game. ps. your car starts on reverse for god knows why. first thing you'll do is crash on the cones behind you.

lost my save data due to a powercut, couldn't restore from steam cloud because it doesn't work. i attempted to download a save file from the internet, so i could pick up the story where i left it, but that doesn't work because save files are locked to a specific rockstar social club profile. plus, every time i tried to boot the game whilst i was messing around trying to get the save file to work, i had to watch a stupidly long intro cutscene. don't even bother with this game. it's not ing worth the hassle.

overall an okay shmup, interesting twist on the old powerup system that i love so much, but nothing to write home about. there are about as many enemy ships in this game as powerups in a normal shmup, which spread over short waves, is very very few. the game gets repetative quickly. the rest of the mechanics are okay, what you'd expect from an older entry. i don't care about the story, it's a shmup. the sole reason for my thumbs down on this title is the rock levels. i wouldn't have reviewed it otherwise. there are a few levels where you have to jump between space rocks, in a puzzle style, very trial and error based, as-boring-as--straight-hours-of-church bundle of rage-causing monotony. as a huge fan of old games, it's 's style last ditch effort at making the game seem more challenging, longer, more interesting and a bit more unique. it's definitely unique, as it's the first shmup i ever stopped playing when i had already nearly beaten it. i won't play this game anymore.

an excellent, gripping, and harrowing tale about the dangers mankind faces from climate change. in a grim future ravaged by sea level rise, you the protagonist ecoterrorist can command your kaiju to rise from the ocean deapths next to albuquerque. you can have your kaiju loot your foes' coal and oil plants for the resources necessary to fund your own development of clean and sustainable fusion power. but your polluting foes will not rest until you are dead, so you must also use your kaiju to gater resources to build base defenses so you can fufill your green ambitions. out of never thought i would really enjoy using a giant mechanized death robot to spread a sustainable environmental message.

excellent game. when i was first introduced to it, i have to say i was worried i would be dissapointed, but i'm glad i got it. it takes a while to learn about all the components, items, abilities, etc. but what i have found helpful is to have the wiki pulled up on my second monitor so i can learn as i go. once you get the hang of it, it's an awesome game, a good time-waster, and all around impressive for the work of an indie developer.

interesting a-symetrical pvp game, odd design choice to have one side trying to avoid pvp to do pve grinding and level up while the other side tries to catch them. can be fun but often the teams are just terrbily balanced there appears to be no match making whatso ever except going off your level , and as they wiped the level for release you will find a lot of experienced low level players right now. that should fix itself. cant recommend it , it is good and well made but its severely lacking content , there are modes but are variations of the . which i dont like myself. very niche game worth a look if you love a-symetrical pvp games but i think more people wont like it than will so watch plenty of vids to really get a feel for it before deciding. and its very expensive for the content provided.

betrayer is a bad game. it's the kind of quality you'd shrug at if it were a student work. it's the kind of game built off of a handful of vague ideas that never really justify their existence. knowing that it's shepherded by the minds behind f.e.a.r. only adds to its disappointment. despite this, betrayer gets to be an exceedingly rare type of game. one that come dawdling around only one every great while it's inherently fun, fascinating, and beautiful. it's visual style is compelling, even if it makes some sections nigh unplayable. it's combat is janky and slow, but is so unlike anything else it becomes enjoyable. for every negative the game boasts, there's an equally unique and compelling reason to play. it's a rare thing indeed, to be as special a game as betrayer, and if the idea of something like that speaks to you, then you should do yourself a favour and play it.

finished it in about minutes of playing. first off, let's look at the gameplay. it's text based, so no need for fancy graphics cards or an hd monitor meaning the range of people that can play it grows massively. the music is quite fitting of the theme and isn't just one boring loop which is always nice. what i really liked about this game though, is the message it sends across and how well it does this. it makes you realise what living with depression is like and reminds you to be there for you friends and family. having seen what depression can do and how easy it is to miss the signs, this is a game i definitely reccomend to anyone as somtimes, one good friend is all you need to realise why life's worth living.

i unfortunately would not recommend enter the gungeon to binding the isaac fans, which seems to be a large part of its base. the game has a disappointing lack of synergies and lack of strategy when it comes to item selection. the binding of isaac has so many micro-strategy decisions outside of the actual combat that make the game intriguing to replay. enter the gungeon's early game does not have this. perhaps it comes later, but it didn't hook me enough to find out. the combat is tight and polished, but ultimately unfulfilling and punishing. i really wished this game would have been more like binding of isaac with guns, but sadly it was not.

here's the thing i liked this game, but i couldn't wait to finish it. i enjoyed playing it, but i know i won't ever play it again. the graphics were great, gameplay was fluid, and the three characters you utilize are all diverse enough to give everyone their own style. but for some reason, the only reason i played this game -- and continued playing it to the end -- was to get it off my 'not completed' list. i felt no push to find out what happened next, or get all the achievements, or even explore. i got the whole thing done in maybe three or four hours, and i don't imagine myself playing it any more.

hands down best free arpg game on steam as of now. path of exile has gigantic skill trees, and a wide variety of maces, swords, axes, staffs, and wands. different monsters in every area keeps the game exciting and very fun. i'm not really a big fan of arpg or rpg games, but games like poe and dust an elysian tale have really made me a fan of the genre. if you don't want to get poe because you aren't interested in rpg games, then you shouldn't be. the game is free, as you prbably already know, and there's no cons about getting the game. highly recommended for anyone looking for a good game to play. also invite your friends to play. poe is a good game when playing solo. but even better when you have another person to help you on quests. the quests are not very hard on normal, especially if you have someone to help you. overall, poe is a game that never seems to disappoint. it in fact does not get boring as some games might eventually grow to be. i would get poe, because there's nothing to lose, and it is an excellent game.

this game looks lovely, but you're not going to see much of anything different after the first minutes. the 'ghost' has no indication of what attracts him to you, or that he's about appear. this started as a scary thing, but after deaths or so becomes a 'you again.' moment. sometimes you'll be sprinting away, jsut to automatically transition to a little stroll. this sort of makes sense in the game, but its about the silliest thing your character could do in the middle of a landslide. navigating the tricky terrain is the main challenge of the game, and its not fun or engaging. i'm sure vaguely different rock shapes is the realistic way of going about it, but it made this game pretty boring. truly disappointing, because i was excited to try this. honestly i'm into walking simulators, but not this one.

camera controls are ridiculous once you start heading into co-op. there's a game mechanic where if an enemy patrol spots you, it spawns more enemies. its usually somewhere close to the edge of your screen if you're playing solo. but if you're in a group, it forces the camera to center in the middle of the group, which makes it harder to see the edges of the screen. patrols will get startled immediately because its extremely difficult to react to the enemies even if you're in a tight group. i submitted a refund request, and if you plan on playing with anybody, i do not recommend buying this game.

i really wanted to like this game. being a big fan of what it's trying to mimic, dungeon keeper . it falls short in every aspect that made the other game great. the base building in the campaign is severely restricted, indestructable blocks everywhere. it's way too fast paced, especially compared to what it's supposed to be the spiritual successor of. it has far too many gimmicky functions that just makes it more complicated than it has to without adding any fun to it whatsoever. the narrator talks constantly, to the point where you want to strangle him. a plus though is that it's the same guy who voice acted the mentor in dk just that he is now incredibly irritating instead of helpful and witty. you might like it if you have nothing to compare it to but if you're a fan of dk and you're expecting a dk you'll be disappointed.

teslagrad is a very beautiful, but extremely unforgiving game. this is not so much a puzzle adventure game as it is a platforming game with some mild puzzle elements. the exploration element does not seem to show up as far as i have seen - most areas have a fairly specific solution without alternatives. if you don't have very sharp reflexes, expect this game to kill you ruthlessly. the pattern and strategy for the first boss, for example, is quite easy to grasp, but the actual execution requires very quick reflexes. i hate to be harsh on such a excellent looking game, but this is a game strictly for platforming fans with little crossover appeal.

evoland tugs at the player's nostalgia so hard that it forgets to accomplish anything else. referencing old game mechanics or design choices makes for a better wiki than an actual game. 'remember random encounters?' evoland asks. i do, and i hated them less than when you implemented them. 'remember when games like this were challenging?' evoland reminisces. again, yes. but your game is not hard and it's not very fun. it's a simple tour of the past. players should keep their nostalgia glasses to remember great, old games. you will not remember evoland.

total war attila seems to be like a poorer version of the total war rome ii. in battle there isn't the zoom camera option to a single unit like in total war rome ii. in addition campaign in this game seems to be way more challenging than in total war rome ii, in a bad way. in total war rome ii, in turn i could raise many armies and capture many new cities, of course not without challenge. in total war attila you can hardly make anything happen in turns. it takes many hours to get anything done in this game. compared to total war rome ii, in attila when i upgrade buildings in my cities to boost food, public order and units, i get only a fraction of the benefits what you could get in total war rome ii. i do all these upgrades and what? still bad public order and mediocre units. this game could have been way better, i hope there are some updates coming.

one of the worst 'racing' games i have ever played. people will tell you it's about going fast and doing stunts but it's not. most of your time will be spent trying to figure out just what the level designer was thinking if you play online. most of the tracks are cobbled together messes that have no real flow to them, meaning you'll be doing fine one second then flinging over a guardrail because you didn't turn at juuuust the right fraction of an inch to make the next turn causing you to start over. after a few hours of spamming the delete reset key, it became evident that racing new tracks was more of a chore than fun. stick to the free to play version, this is not worth money.

so it seems that activision doesn't know the meaning of black ops anymore. a black operation or black op is a covert operation by a government, a government agency, or a military organization. key features of a black operation are that it is secret and it is not attributable to the organization carrying it out. there is nothing that makes you feel like a secret or covert soldier in this game from start to end, it's michael bay t left and right, explosions and cluster battles. it's also really sad that they didn't spend more then minutes making the port to pc, i have not seen more poorly optimized game.

this is one of those rhythm games that should be on your 'i should play this game maybe' list. although the game seems simple not really , it isn't. the timing is the key here obviously, but timing for what? jumping? that isn't the only move you'll be doing here. anyways, the soundtrack is nice and it matches with the things you'll collect, like when you collect a pile of those bars, the music will also have something special at exactly that time. this is what makes this game even more enjoyable. the bars determine your score, so better collect 'em all. it would be more fun if you have people in your friend list that have played this game. you'd be more motivated to do the levels perfectly and beat their scores. all in all, this game is awesome and you should definitely try it out. lil' sucky gameplay to go with the review.

while my 'hours played' may seem decisively miniscule though they were actually just reset this game has improved so much over the course of its lifetime. it started out as simply a terraria clone where we weren't limited to a single planet, then slowly began to add more and more to its planets and civilizations. then, during its darkest period, the community and chucklefish began to become estranged. the game began to drag on, like another one of those early access projects that would never be completed. but, as we can see, they are finally past that state. this game is one of the very few games that i believe can make a personal connection with people. if you are at least considering buying starbound, just buy it.

this is one of those odd indie games that leaves you looking for hidden meanings and wondering what it was all about at the end. the style was neat and the music is excellent, and the tone is a little off-beat just when it seems to be getting 'in character', it throws some contemporary language in to mix you up. the gameplay elements based on the current real-time lunar phase was a neat mix. the one caveat i would add is that combat can be challenging there isn't a lot of combat overall it's mostly a puzzle game , but combat does require some good timing and was harder than i was expecting from an otherwise casual game. if you enjoy puzzle games, i'd definitely recommend trying superbrothers sword amp sworcery ep, especially if you can catch it on sale.

nostalgic, topical, painful, heart-felt..this game had me hoping there would be closure for my companions and that though this is just a fantasy game, there are comparisons to real-life racism, anomie, and conflict. sometimes there is an obvious moral high ground, many times there is no right or wrong choice. will you choose to to be emotional, benevolant, rational, or cruel in your dealings. your attitude will create a reputation that follows you in the game. while i have not completed this game at the time of this review, i have a foreboding sense that the ending will be pyrrhic.

the only real improvement over the original arma is that there are slightly less bugs. otherwise, it still has the same bad or broken mechanics, slow cumbersome interface, bad singleplayer campaign, and inconsistent or cheating ai my favourite ai tanks that seem to wall hack you . the only reason to ever play arma is because it is more realistic than other series like battlefield, and it mostly is, but some parts are not realistic at all, which creates a bad bipolar mixture. the dlc campaigns are marginally better but far too short. sadly, the arma series can still feel more like a good tech-demo than a properly polished game. if only arma's scale and realism were combined with battlefield's accessibility and polish, it would be amazing.

let's be honest. this is not an action game, no matter how much it seems like it. it's a very short puzzle game i beated it within a few hours with a few jump run 'action' sequences thrown in. and the puzzles aren't very interseting beyond 'do i jump or find a key to get through this zone'. the story's pretty stereotypical zombie apocalypse tale, so there's nothing interesting there. it's not the worst game ever made, but i can't recommend paying for it certainly no more than a or so . i got it as a part of a humblebundle, but i probably wouldn't have bought it or kept it otherwise.

i have played the left dead game for years, and still play, it is such a fun pick up and play game, and its re-playability is second to none. if? this is meant to have stolen its crown, then it has turned up at the wrong vault. this has nowhere near the staying power of left dead. the playable characters are not as fun. the setting is not as fun. the enemies are very lack lustre, bordering on the boring. the ai is some of the worst i have seen it makes this game look as though it was programed years before left dead. left dead has proven itself as a commercial worldwide game, this young pretender seems as though its running in the wrong race. it s not a bad game but very mediocre, i will play it from time to time.

this game barely gets a thumbs up from be mainly because its a new concept, nice art, nice music etc. . the biggest problem is that the game is based on luck. no matter how good you are at the game, you always depend on luck to constantly find planets with enough fuel, iron and oxygen. just be prepared to get frustrated a lot. for example even though you captured an amazing new ship, spent a lot of time discovering new technology, collecting the rare resources to build tech upgrades etc. etc. and then, bam, a random event makes you lose half of your fuel, and you end up in a solar system without any gas planets. game over in two turns, and nothing you could do about it. this happens a lot! unfortunately, the devs don't wanna hear anything about it. check the forums, they wanna keep this game a game of chance, to somehow show you the 'thoughness' of space travel or whatever. i think its sad, the game could be so much better and more skill based.. i hope modders will fix it, like it happened with ftl.

my follower is a ghoul named raul who adresses me with boss, and makes my items wear down slower. oh, also, this game is wonderful, i still haven't finished the game with every 'class'possible , so to speak, just because there are so many different ways you can do it, say you want to talk your way out of most situations, namely the ones that don't involve itchy trigger-fingered human humanoids or general wildlife, you can do it. you want to go on a mad rampage killing everyone and everything in your path, sure, go at it. feeling like shooting the head off of your very boss, who contracted you to deliver a ing casino chip to him? why not? finished the game once before? want to bypass half the starting quest? you got it buddy! want to make scrap metal to ammo? get the right perks, skills, and s.p.e,c,i.a.l. and you can do that too! basicly this game fullfills what it set out to do be an rpg. and if you think there's something missing, just check out the modding community, chances are, there's a mod to help you with that.

the game was of a mediocre kind of dungeons and dragons skyrim sort of minecraft knock-off, but it was fairly on the better side of knock-offs, but that's also one of many reasons why i'm giving it a bad review. the game itself is fairly fun, minus the ungodly amount of lag, and all the in-app purchases keeping you from having too much fun. now i will talk about the controls. if it were for ios, or android, i would have let this go, but the 'controls' barely controlled anything, much less everything. personally, i'm not very biased against knock-off f p games, but it was just too impossible to play without the egregious amount of iaps, and without a solid controller option. all in all, i'd give this game a out of , and would recommend nearly any game over this virtually unplayable game without hackers and there are plenty of those . out of with hackers

the game is very linear, requiring the player to follow a trail of green moss through a 'lifeless planet'. since the planet is lifeless, most of what you find are rocks, rocks, and well, rocks. you will have to push the rocks around, jump from rock to rock, and sometimes you will find yourself trapped inside a rock! finishing the game with a fair amount of exploration takes about hours. around . of those hours will be spent walking between 'puzzles', hour will be spent walking back to the puzzle that you didn't quite make the next ledge so you died and went back to a checkpoint, and about . hours will be spent actually working through the puzzles. these 'puzzles' are nearly always just platforming with one exception near the end of the game . this game has a simple story that advances through the game, but provides the player with a somewhat hopeless ending if months are weeks and centuries may have passed, would someone be kept on life support for s of years? overall, about out of stars. would not recommend the game.

this game is a technical disaster, a mish-mash of artstyles and creative directions - and, well - the music is fine enough. from the starting tutorial, it feels nearly impossible to 'get a feel' for the controls, and after hours of playtime - i'm still constantly baffled by this game's technical choices. it's quite obvious the game's technical director told the development team to keep adding in graphical improvements, and more, and more - to the point where it is literally unplayable in.. well, most areas. the controls and gameplay will have you wondering what direction you're going to be firing your weapon or swinging your sword - and often leave you open to the quite difficult enemy's attacks. with a.. what.. year old rig with fairly upgraded parts, decent amount of ram and a minimalistic set of processes - i can't get this game above fps nearly anywhere. and in most parts it is far worse, with paralaxing backgrounds and rain effects in addition to all the lighting and particle effects that put the game in its currently nearly unplayable state. don't buy, don't rent. go grab terraria and have some fun with your life d

very cute but utterly brainless. this is the story of how two girls who are now dating met each other and spent months not getting along very well at all. the majority of this vn is a tale about when they weren't in love and were mostly in conflict. the characterisations are really shallow, any real feeling of human personality has been replaced by 'conformity' vs 'non-conformity', we never find out any specifics of the source of miya's troubles at home, and i found it overall really unsatisfying. and rather boring. i feel like the sales blurb on the store pretty much sums up the entire story. artwork is pretty. music is pleasant but bland. no specific issues with the quality of translation. i wouldn't dismiss the rest of this series based on this game, but i wouldn't recommend this game to others unless they very specifically liked shallow stories about cute girls miscommunicating and being angry for pointless reasons.

i played this game as freeware back when it first got translated into english, and i've always enjoyed the other miscreant's room games, so i figured i'd go ahead and put my money where my thanks was. the gameplay hasn't changed much, as far as i can remember. i guess you could go to the translator's website and play basically the same game for free, but it's worth it to support sen. pros about this game it's a horror game with only a few jumpscares, and most of those are very mild the sound design can be really annoying at times. aya's scream in particular sounds more like somebody stole her cupcake and less like she got murdered by sentient dolls. even when the scream was part of a cutscene, my sister would look up from across the room and say, did you die again? the father isn't really mad. he seems quite happy, in fact. and if you try to tell me he's 'mad' in that he is insane, i'd have to say no, he really isn't. he has no mental illness. he is just an a hole.

what an atrocity.. fear and were absolutely fantastic games that were unrivaled in the fusion of horror and fps, and still are, to this day. eventually fear came along to complete the trilogy. fear had atmosphere, difficulty, great story and great gameplay. fear had more of the same, but with a more streamlined approach to the story, but it didn't have as many open ended levels. fear ditched the horror, the good writing and ended up adding coop to follow the coop craze. the game was not difficult, the horror elements were completely removed, and the story was so out of wack, incongruent and just horribly written. both the first fear games had incredible ai that provided difficulty. here, they might as well just be standing still. the level design is horribly linear, with no options of going in a different way. do yourselves a favor and stay away from this atrocity. if you were a fan of the first games, this game will do nothing but sour your memory of the series. avoid this like the plague!

this game is a lot of fun! it definitely toes the line of what i'm comfortable playing, because you shooting a bunch of cops and stupid innocent bystanders in the process. still, for a prude like me it's fantastical enough that i'm able to look past that. sometimes. gameplay is very challenging, which i like. it takes some planning, some familiarity with the map, and a whole lot of teamwork to make things go semi-smoothly. the graphics are really top-notch and the controls fairly intuitive - some of it took a little getting used to. skill selection isn't really explained in the game so look up a video on youtube so you know what you need to do - once you get it down it's easy enough. definitely worth the , or get some friends together and go in on a -pack. if you enjoy fps co-op games like left dead, borderlands or dead island, you'll enjoy this game.

tactical intervention is a first person shooter type of game. it has similar ties to counter-strike since 'gooseman' was part of the team that developed counterstrike. pros - an idea of car chasing which is extremely buggy - has the same idea as counter-strike cons god forbid that this will not take the whole review - extremely buggy - contains the dreaded p w system pay win - the car chase is good at first, but gets down to hell buggy later - guns that are bought using in-game cash is temporary, however some are permanent but those are hella expensive. - first few minutes might be fine, but gets offbeat later and you get the feeling of the enemy's guns being op, considering you're not a p w player. - at rare times, a bug in the vip game mode gets extremely rediculous. as it switches the vip to another player. - the rappeling is not fun at all

its basically a d version of eve, but without the boredom and complicated ui. ..or even think of it like a multiplayer version of space pirates and zombies, if you've played that. tons of ships, tons of stuff to put in the ships, hundreds of planets to explore and trade and hunt and pirate and get blown up and spending the first few hours of your life paying off the loan to the bank for your starter ship. npcs everywhere, doing thier own thing. my only gripes - - i'd like to see a mining system - i'd like to see a slightly more robust chat interface. people move too fast to click on and hail. also theres so many freaking ships its hard to tell who's human or npc. i've only sank a few hours into it, and i'm already in love. also its free and opensource. ..and only like mb. do it.

this game was probably good years ago but it's not anymore. the combat is basic and the ai is infuriating. but as it's an action game based around escorting people to a safe house, that's not a great combination. the save system is designed to give the game a rolling 'new game plus' mode in a sense, where each subsequent game carries over the skills stats of the previous combined playthroughs, however the overall affect is a sense that your time is being wasted. cant possibly recommend this, unless you played it on it's original release and loved it. and the controls are total even on a gamepad .

this game is amazing and don't let the dlc scare you away. vanilla brings hundreds maybe thousands hours of gameplay, and with all the dlc it brings you up even higher. it was only people making it full time and right now only person is maintaining and making dlc full time. they sometimes bring in other people to work on small things but mostly on person at a time works on it. that is why there is a lot of dlc. just that it's almost years old and new content is still getting pushed out is a sign that this game is worth the price. i definitely recommend this to any rpg and or strategy fans. if you don't want to fight wars, then don't. if you want to be a tyrant then do it. possibilities are endless.

smrpg feels broken and patchy. i can't recommend it, the on screen elements are very abrasive and the movement is finicky. the ui is awful - won't stay set to gamepad controls displayed, so i constantly had no idea which button to press. the 'folder' is difficult to navigate and the game elements attacks, boosts, etc are never really explained, which left me just equipping and buying and spamming things all over the place. the stats are not explained or really referenced anywhere so i was left applying miscellaneous boosts that might have had an impact. with a couple of improvements or indeed an overhaul of the menu folder system and a bit more indication for what to use, the game might be playable, but it would need many more changes for me to recommend it.

imagine you have theme hospital a very fun, very goofy hospital sim, in all of its glory. now, remove the clever sense of humor, the fun art style, pretty much any sense of creativity, and then throw in a soap opera mechanic that makes what little the game had going for it feel even worse. now you have hospital tycoon. for those of you that want to play a fun hospital sim, look up theme hospital, it's available on multiple platforms including pc. for those of you that have already played theme hospital, well, there's no place like home.

fahrenheit was the first great game from david cage, the mind behind the ps out of exclusive titles heavy rain and beyond two souls. just as those two titles, it divided fans and critics into two very far apart groups those who loved and those who hated that kind of storytelling. fahrenheit was partially wonky, being a debut and all, but it featured amazing storytelling and gameplay back at it's time with a lot of branching regarding individual storylines. it is by far not a perfect game, but still a milestone of gaming and deserves any and all attention it can get.

after playing countless hours on black ops ii, i wanted to relax and play some old school waw zombies. came with every zombie map in waw. zombies was really fun. i got to use the old world war ii weapons on zombies, and people weren't lying when they said that world at war is probably the bloodiest and goriest cod out on the market today. if only the multiplayer servers weren't hacked and modded, i could have some actual fun playing multiplayer using wwii weaponry. there is literally zero vanilla servers, and it literally feels like i'm looking for a server in garry's mod. i'll give this game a out of due to multiplayer being terrible, but zombies are about the only thing you want to get this game for, unless you want to play on a modded hacked server. definitely not worth ., or even ., but probably like ., which is when it is off.

planetside has great mechanics. it's basically free-to-play battlefield, in space, with hundreds and hundreds of people on each map. this would probably be in my top ten games of all time, if it wasn't for the business model. you can either grind certs basically unlock points for for weeks to get a gun for one class, or you can pay real money to get the weapons unlocked instantly, and transferrably. for some, they may be able to grind out certs with the awful weapons each starts out with until they get some equipment they enjoy, but otherwise the game is pretty terrible unless you pay actual money. out of great mechanics, great graphics, probably one of the worst business models i've seen. it's comparable to freemium facebook games.

you know, normally i'm the kind of fan of crude humor and over the top action, i saw the parkour aspect of it and said 'hey i'll give it a go' but it's good to the point where you begin to notice the details and it's a story that tugs on your heartstrings. not gonna lie solid out of it's short but it's like one of those sweet stories i picked up off of my uncle bob, heh what a coincidence.

thomas was alone is the my turns funny, dramatic, and genuinely touching tale of a group of colored rectangles with an uncanny ability to get in each others' way. it is also an actual game, like that you play, so that's good too.

its okay. that a problem. a video game should not be 'okay'. it should be fantastic. especially with a aaa studio. the gameplay is fun, as long as you've got some friends to play with. however, the game is a grind to get weapons and stuff. you can literally do a mission over an over again, just to get a f---ing attachment for your weapon. the gameplay is slightly repetitive, especially as i said above when grinding. stealth is usually not an option, so thats also a downside. it does have it's ups, though. combat feels quite exciting. there's several ways to perform and execute the heist. if you have a bunch of money and a bunch of friends, i'd buy this. just don't be surprised if you find yourself bored within a couple hours.

well do not listen to the description as this is not an eastern front game. this is basically company of heroes with the russian army as not only did they add the western front armies as dlc but now they added the british..if you actually wanted an eastern front rts game then look elsewhere probably at men at war. if you enjoy the dried up western armies over the all the armies that took place on the eastern front then yes i recommend it. however if you actually wanted something different that showed where the vast majority of wwii was fought then i strongly recommend you look elsewhere. don't get me wrong, i enjoy the gameplay and the units of both the ussr and the wehrmacht, but the overabundance of western armies completely ruin the game for me. i shall say it again, if you don't mind western armies then by all means decide for yourself. i simply put this out there for people like myself who really craved an eastern front rts that actually focused on the eastern front.

it has nothing to do with the old homeworld games.none of the atmosphere,the cutscenes etc are banal boring feely woman researcher point of view. the story is weak,no developments,i thought the game was gonna really kick off when it ended instead.this was not so in homeworld.it is almost an intro for a story. i don't know what everybody is going on giving this positive reviews but it has a hour sp campaign,nothing special about it. i guess people are supporting for old time's sake and another homeworld game.but it is plain old strategy game on par with old command and conquer games.yeah the only difference is the base is moving.it's graphics are good,gameplay is not boring.it could have been better with a better story,but the elements incorporated are weak.the dev's should have seen it on the board that they were lacking,but alas.honestly hire a few new graduates out of the school and let them go for it.it's a very bland story,it just doesn't work. haven't tried multi yet,but i wouldn't buy it at sales prices,not suggested.

i've bought and played this at launch last , but i could only play it on a proper machine just now since i've recently upgraded my worn out video card radeon to a geforce gtx . even on the highest settings, it doesn't use a lot of vram to cripple my video card's . gb upper limit. surprisingly, tressfx runs well even with an nvidia video card. i've managed to complete the game at . yay me! but there's surprisingly little to do after the game has ended because there are no unlimited enemies here where you can hone and practice your shooting and archery skill anytime you want. i'd be looking forward for the next tomb raider game, but sadly, it's a timed console exclusive.. it's kinda a letdown for pc gamers but i guess this game does not come cheap to begin with and at least, it will eventually be released to us.. it's just terrible to play this on a controller.

the best way to describe rainbow six siege to someone is to compare it to csgo because rainbow six siege is a better version of csgo. why is it a better version of csgo you might be asking yourself? because rainbow six siege is csgo with destructible maps, more characters, more weapon customization, more tacticle and real gun play, and a co-op and multiplayer mode. in rainbow six siege cover is your best way to stay alive but your cover can also be destroyed so your always on the move. - shots will kill you depending on the weapon your enemy is using. bullet about damage i think and you only have health but your team mates can revive you if they get to you fast enough but you can increase the time you have to be revived by trying to decrease the blood your loosing. honestly im enjoying rainbow six siege so far and i've gotten alot of fun from this game. at the time i'm uploading this review i'd have to give rainbow six siege a out of because the attention to detail is amazing, the gameplay is even better, and i love games with destructible maps

retro graphics, 's-influences aesthetics and music. you're smearing the painfully purple carpets with blood of mobsters as you, some nameless masquerading dude, go through apartments with only one goal in mind kill everyone else and get a nifty high score! the core game mechanics are unforgiving, quick-paced and ramps up nicely. the game looks great and if you're the kind of person that doesn't enjoy pixel graphics - tough luck and trippy with some design choices, which is fine. and, during all this a great soundtrack becomes the cherry on the cake, completing the mood of just going forwards and forwards. the gameplay might take some getting used to, mainly matching up your turning, hitting and picking up weapons which is done with mouse, to the walking that you do with the wasd-keys. some ai is pretty buggy at times, though it can either help you or force you to restart a level. nevertheless, for the price it is and the price it goes on sale i definitely recommend it!

this game is a great stress release. as a goat, i bring mayhem to unsuspecting people and objects.. so much distruction, so little time. add to that an awesome variety of in game and steam achievements, with no rush or demand to get them done.. take your time! explore your surrounds.. summon your inner goat, bring forth goatblivion through dark ritual! yes, some may say this game has it all. truthfully, i don't know as i have not completed it, but after one nights play i know where i can go to escape normality and release my inner goat freely. out of some little tips tricks go a long way in this game, like using your slow motion button to help complete the achievement 'walk on two front legs'.. but this is a game where you put a little in - get a load out!

poker night at the inventory is a fun distraction, but i felt the only reason i had any emotional investment in it is that i wanted to win the team fortress items which are only available through this game. this made me ask myself 'if i don't buy items in tf , why did i buy this game to get some tf items?' i suppose the answer is that i get to play a game in the process of obtaining those items, but the ai seems much too random in betting patterns to provide a truly enjoyable poker experience. which means you are really just working to earn those tf items and on top of that you have to pay money just for the privilege to work for them. i'd say buy this if you want to win the tf items, but if it's poker you're after there's surely better games out there. or better yet just grab a real deck of cards and host your own poker night with your mates. out of , would not bet.

since the advent of video games, programmers wanted you to either create your own character or become a persona of their design. not many games can achieve the former. this one does. after you get around the somewhat dubious translations and awful menu ui, e.y.e. divine cybermancy allows you to craft any character you want, forging and destroying various alliances, leveling your character to be the world's foremost hacker, or warrior monk, or secretive sniper, or blood magic aficianado, or tech genius, or ninja assassin i'm not joking etc. etc.the source engine visuals are getting a bit old, and the render distance is destroyed by an inexplicable fog, but there is much to love about this game as long as you don't mind digging a little.

dead pixels is a pixel based shooter i hope you already figured this out from the title . you play a guy who is trying to survive a zombie apocalypse. you have to make your way through the world killing zombies and buying upgrades and weapons. there is a good deal of replayability as well. multiple game modes spice up the fun even more! i am not usually a fan of zombie survival games as of late it feels like there are a lot of them now but i like this one. also it reminds me a little of binding of issac, so thats something. i would definitely recommend this to someone looking for a cheap indie game.

i bought this game due to someone i know enjoying it and figured i would give it a try. i have to say, i regret doing so. the game is so straight forward and lacks any sort of new ingenuity. i know it's supposed to be a 'throw back' game, but damn. it's just too much. your characters classes are dull. it gives the hint of leveling up freedom to bend the classes somewhat, but with the point system your basically making one type of character, or making a super weak useless character that 'breaks the mold'. the story seems deep at first, but i found it was sort of 'meh' after a point. the in game npcs are horrible. there is a certain might and magic vibe to the game. if you were really into the m amp m games and want to play something like them again. perhaps this game is for you. if not, i can't suggest it.

drop down into the battlefield! no more spawning and pre-defined positions, you choose where you want to be, you fly from the sky towards your objective, crashing down in the midst of war, gun firing all the while, shooting down enemy after enemy, and just as you sigh with relief to your teammates that the control point was succesfully taken over, you look into the sky and see shimmering streaks falling down, enemy reinforcements just arriving to take back their territory. section is my favourite fps, it allows brilliant tactics, has graphics that aren't too shabby, and the gameplay is simply awesome! furthermore, you can call in vehicles, supply drops, turrets, whatever you need in the midst of the battlefield to satisfy your needs! hold your position, or bring hell to the enemy!
this is the best gaming series i've ever played, it might be hard to get into but it's worth man it's worth.

thief is an immersive stealth game that takes in the aspect of garrett, the master thief. thief is a great reboot that defines stealth very well and when i say stealth, i mean not touching or interacting with a single soul around you, staying quiet and panther-like. you are a thief that now has a story, a meaning of which you pursue to find out what happens to your apprentice. this is a great experience combined with some tactics and gadgets that you possess, you can play the game however you want, finding alternative routes, using different weapons and equipment to outsmart your enemies and do what thieves do best-- steal without trace. i personally love the story and the punishing master thief difficulty.

this game is an insane amount of fun! it brings me back to my days of pumping quarter after quarter into machines in the arcade, except with much better graphics. the four different game modes are challenging, especially minefield mode, where you don't have any offensive weaponry at all and must rely on your defensive armaments to take out your foes. survival is probably one of the more difficult ones classic is more like galaga galaxian space invaders where you can't let the aliens get past you since you're the last line of defense . defend is more like a tower defense-style mode, where you have to keep your satellites safe for a set time period thankfully there are turrets to help out . i already mentioned the better graphics i think that the artwork on this game is really good. sound effects are pretty good as well, although unlike the previous reviewer, i didn't have an issue with the music. i thought it fit pretty well. finally, i would highly recommend using an xbox controller to play this game controls are much more fluid. i highly recommend this game, especially if you love twin-stick space shooters, and a challenge!!

just imagine if this game was fully baked. sleeping dogs is a game where you play as an undercover cop who attempts to infiltrate into a triad gang. it's essentially a gta from the police perspective- expect the rule's aren't quite the same for those undercover.. lots of melee combat here- you're pretty much bruce leeing the hell out of everyone most of the time. gunplay is included too, but not very much of it. in all honesty the guns seem like an afterthought. they do unrealistically low damage and are extremely hard to get. you'd think every gangster would be packin', but nope. the sheer number of things that you can do in this game is insane. in all honesty, this game could have become a series that would rival gta easily if it was just finished better. you're still getting a great game with lots of gameplay though. also the dlc is meh, though the cop one is pretty good.

initially the game was great, a breath of fresh air into the fps genre. but now i can't help but feel like the payday fanbase and community are being used as cash cows. the dlc for this game is bizarre, requiring you to pay which i'm sure will increase over time for the complete experience, and without the dlc, your ingame arsenal heist options will feel quite meager. recently overkill have released the addition of safes into the payday world which rely on you paying a sum of real money to open, the reward of which the player might not even be able to implement if they do not own the correct dlc. i can't help but feel mislead and disapointed from overkill's decision to add microtransactions in the game, which they had stated a while ago that if anyone was to think that overkill were going to add microtransactions, they should be ashamed of themselves. it feels as though they are just adding the safe mechanic to generate more money from the games fans.

don't starve together is simply one of the best sandbox survival game i have ever played. the art is very unique.. let's say it is creepy yet cute! the survival system is incredible addicting since you need to plan ahead what to do to survive in the next season. there are a lot of stuff to learn and you will die a lot at the beginning but fear not! learn from your failure and do it better next time imo this game is incredible fun if you play it with friends or alone. joining random servers is fun too but don't get too attached with your character there cause most of them will do a clean wipe when everyone dies. doesn't matter if you are online or not the developers are very passionate, shipping out regular updates and the result is a strong community and modders that creates lot of entertaining custom content in the workshop so you won't get bored easily p i highly recommend this game, even without sales it's worth the money!

absolutely disgusting. the computer blatantly forgoes strategy simply to stuff it in the human player's . i was playing expert using human profiles for myself against computers. i had red in africa and blue in south america. gold had australia and a foothold in europe. my african boarders were all protected with soldiers, and green who had europe did not have more than on a single territory. so what does gold do? does he take the logical approach and secure europe for himself? fuuuuuuck no. he plows a trail through africa into south america, just to plant men there. the computer literally disregarded obvious strategy just to ram in against the human players both were me in this case, and believe me, my is sore . it's bad enough that the dice roll is blatantly biased in favor of the computer to the point that i sent sets of territories against territory defended by soldier, and lost or soldiers doing so, but to have the computer not even operate strategically is just too much. i want to like this game, but they should have worked on these mechanics a little more.

this new long term approach to magic's 'casual' games is a big improvement over the duels of the planewalkers and magic xx titles. with each new expansion adding new content and a reasonable ability to play human and computer opponents, this manages to be a good time killer while you're on lunch or whatnot. it'll likely keep getting better with new releases as well. it isn't without its flaws though, so be warned. - it buggy, often crashing when you open packs, and some cards don't work like they should - the control interface is currently poor, and occasionally infuriating, but could be fixed in future updates - the story mode is really bad. with plot points like 'your friends disagree with your approach to this problem, beat them nearly to death in order to come to an agreement! other than those things, it's pretty good. certainly worth the free price tag for the download.

completely broken save system resulted in me playing the minute unskippable-cutscene tutorial mission twice. the game creates 'autosaves' but shows them as 'locked' unless you beat the hour long linear level milestones. in a non-linear game like dark souls this system works, but this is a shooter on rails with a single scripted story path. i'd avoid this game unless they fix this issue

undoubtedly one of the best rpg's ever made. combining a campaign map with real-time battle maps in a similar style to the total war franchise but in which you control a single army within your faction, the game takes on a more personal feeling than total war. the faction and relationship systems create a miniature game of thrones, enabling you to contend with your rivals for power, both against enemies and allies. furthermore, warband possesses one of the most enjoyable and immersive battle systems in any game. although the graphics may be poor, the gameplay more than makes up for it. a perfect example that flashy graphics are not necessary for an awesome game. the countless mods available for this game only add to its brilliance. the developers support for the modding community makes the mods easy to install and play and some of them are arguably even better than the base game. definitely worth trying out. out of

so much fun! the combat plays like an even more polished version of the batman games. the controls are not clunky in the slightest, everything feels really tight and responsive. the game runs very well, even on my year old system, with all settings at or near max. the biggest plus, for me, is the nemesis system. killing random orcs is fun, but it's the encounters with the orc captains that really sets the game apart. each orc captain has a different personality, and they each will remember encounters if you come across them again. affecting the power struggles internal to the orc army is really interesting. so far i've played for roughly hours, and i've still only done or of the main story missions because the nemesis system is so engrossing!

metal gear solid v is a frankenburger. the design is flawless. countless hours of painstaking research have gone into creating the most perfectly designed burger ever, with every aspect of its composition being fine-tuned for perfection. you could write a thesis about how absolutely perfectly crafted this burger is. but there's a dark side to it. it doesn't look that great when you finally get it on your plate. and it might have looked better, if it had more time to be prepared. it's loaded with chemical additives and perservatives that make you feel bad when you're finished eating it. the story behind this burger is a tragic tale of souless corporate s demanding that the perfect burger be created and shipped out to restaurants, even if it isn't as perfect as it could be with more time and love. but it, when you're eating it, when it's in your mouth and you're swallowing down those chemical additives and heart-killing greases, you'll swear it's the best thing you've ever eaten. tl dr, the gameplay godlike but the story is half-finished and kinda disappointing, which may or may not be a problem depending on your tastes.

this game does not exactly play like i thought it would. for some reason i was expecting a story-driven game, perhaps with a dark twist. that is not what this is. instead, this is a bizarre platformer where you walk around peeing on everything. i decided to give it a go anyway. why not, right? i finally had to stop playing, not bc of the gameplay, but bc of a glitch. i jumped when i should have kept walking and got stuck standing in fire while peeing, with frogs and spiders coming out of, well, you know where they were coming out of. mildly disturbing, i know. and nothing in the gameplay, if you can call walking around and peeing on literally everything and everyone 'gameplay', did not make up for the very strange nature of the game. i do not recommend this to anyone. i've got a twisted sense of humor, but this 'game' does not seem to have any point. other than to walk around and pee on everything. so, no.

don't buy this. they say that they're inspired by the old classic survival horror games but they aren't. in those games you could defend yourself or even run away fairly easily, this one, not so much. look i didn't get far enough into the game to be able to suggest whether you should play it or not, but i really didn't have to to get the experience i would be having throughout the entire game. the game makes it so that you have a stamina meter, but if you stop moving for half a second the monster catches up to you and you die. the music, from what i gathered was cliche, it wasn't horrible, so that's a bonus i guess. the cutscenes have no voice acting, only subtitles while they quickly switch between slides, giving you no time to read what the characters are saying unless the subtitles take up more than one slide. this is not how you make a horror game.

originaly, this was a very fun game. it had the best graphics ever seen in a block game, mysteries and puzzles, a feel that you must destroy all dungeons, and best of all it's free. this was the perfect game to just go on a few random quests with a made-up story you just made in your mind, or even just hangout with your best friends, however it gets very very old. after a few weeks of playing, it just loses all the excitement. there aren't any updates good enough to lure old players back, and you are basically doing the same exact thing every single day of your life. it takes so much to get to a high enough level to make things interesting. because of these features, i just can't recommend this game.
