this is a complete disaster of a release. for anyone who enjoyed the pc release of motorhead, this is not it. this is the psx version. the screenshot previews of the game do not even do the shoddy graphics justice. it gave me a headache to even try to play this in fullscreen, and windowed mode is not much better. this game is also impossible to play with a keyboard, which is what i used to play the game back when it was originally released, and the controls cannot be modified. so please do your best to enjoy utilizing both wsad and the num pad not only to drive your vehicle, but to decrypt the main menu navigation, as the mouse does absolutely nothing. please do not waste your money on this game. there were no reviews for it when i purchased it, so i had no forewarning of how bad of a port it would be. you're better off finding the pc port elsewhere. it's a vastly superior experience to this version.

a classic, one of, if not, the best arcade game there is. metal slug is frantic, insane, and a tense game that will keep your reflexes in check. all of the levels are fantasticly made, with thier own little secrets in them. the fact this has online play is amazing itsself, as this game is best with a friend! along with local multiplayer, one using a gamepad, the other a control, two controllers, or both on one keyboard! highly reccomend it, not many arcade games come close to metal slug in terms of fun and replayability!!

there's only one way to die in blackshadows and that is to let your flashlight batteries run out. and i do mean 'let' because there's enough of them lying around to power a shuttle launch. your average kindle book requires more interaction than this. there are five doors to open, the keys to which lie varying distances away through linear corridors. there is no threat. there's no menu. there's two scares where a light blows out and a lightning crash illuminates your would-be adversary in a corridor but neither of them affect anything you're doing. listening to the opening closing narration takes almost half as long as it does to beat the game. utterly, inarguably pointless.

the ship single player is effectively an extended tutorial for the ship's multiplayer game, lasting a little over an hour. the player is given a series of tasks from an npc which all involve killing one or multiple people in a variety of ways while avoiding detection. it's a good overview of the mechanics, but as an independent game, there's not a whole lot to it, so i can't really recommend it. additionally, there's a few mechanical issues on a couple of the quests that can cause game-breaking bugs where you have to reload your save for example, not getting into an elevator and going downstairs a different way in one circumstance . i can't speak for the multiplayer game's community at this point, and i suppose it might be worth it for people who intend to dive wholeheartedly into the game so they can have some extra experience when going in, but as a standalone game, there's not much there.

super gaint games did it again you ruined videogames ever since bastion it a long time to find somthing as engaging experience something with the quality and polish really well made and executed flawlessly as transistor. as it is become to it expected from a supergiant games, the sound and visuals are stunning.combat is in depth and visceral rewarding skill and well thought out strategies is you traverse through your many combatants, there really does not feel to be a dead moment with the spot-on placing. however, all these benefits do come at a cost at a grand total of around to hours. it is not the longest game and considerably shorter than bastion. these hours, you will be spending will never feel that they are wasted. along with the incredibly steep learning curve and punishing difficulty at the start, you only really feel like you're mastering the game at the very end. a well-made engaging experience, if not a little short

this game had a great idea, but fell so short.. i played this game over several months and got to the next to last case. the 'gameplay' was so bad the idea of spending another hour or two to complete the game was like working a job you don't get paid for. which is a shame as there is a story and some okay characters.. the gpx controls sound engine etc.. were all decent, but this should have been a pure puzzle story game with more quests and logic puzzle type gameplay rather than the 'demon' sections which ruined the flow and feel of the game. needed more story and puzzles.. while removing the stupid 'demon' sections ps this is a game which should take - hrs to beat.. the fact that i left it on my hd for so long just goes to show how little the story mattered when related to the boring gameplay.. again, good concept, poor execution..

a fun game with bad poker mechanics, mostly amusing characters i can barely stand claptrap in the borderlands series, he isn't much better here , and a bounty unlockable reward system that half works. the challenge system for gaining the opportunity to unlock bounties is a step-up from the rng of the last game which lead to me restarting until i got bounty games after the dialogue became stale . glados is excellent as always, and having her as the dealer was a wise move. when it comes down to it though, actual poker players say it's nothing like playing poker, and the unlockable bounties for borderlands straight up don't work it's possible to get them if you contact gearbox support, but i think when you have to open a ticket to recieve what is debateably the biggest selling point of the game, the product is fundamentally flawed. this isn't a game for poker players or collectors.

after playing the original 'sonic amp sega all-stars racing' on a wii, i decided to give a try to this new version of the game. at first i wasn't convinced about the 'transformed' part of the game, but now i must admit that it adds a nice and fresh way of gaming that makes it highly entertaining. i really like the full controller support, though if you have non-xbox controllers it can take some time configuring those. just be sure to clear every key you want to program because when you assing a new one, it just adds it to the original one, resulting in some keys to have several actions another nice thing is the both online and splitscreen multiplayer, allowing you to play with friends both locally and over the internet. the ai can be really challenging, i even had some struggle on medium, which helps to keep the game entertaining overall, this is a really nice game and highly entertaining.

this is a cute little adventure story about a robot who tries to save his friend. the relationship with the robot and this world is not unlike the movie wall-e, but without the humans. it's a play-it-once adventure, and after that it's replay value is more to challenge speed and memory. i like that this game includes walkthrough pages within the gameplay itself if such answers are desired. however, since the walkthrough only displays the current scene, puzzles that require items from multiple locations aren't really shown. still, if this game is on sale, i highly recommend to get it and play at least once!

i really want to recommend this game. i'm not going to describe the game in general because many others have already. i like almost everything about this game, except the upgrading system, and in my opinion, it breaks the game. the upgrade system that allows blaze to power up is fine, but is quickly maxed out. the problem is with the 'per game' upgrade. once you get to level labs, if you don't have certain shop items that randomly appear, you will not proceed, no matter what you do. difficult is one thing, being put continuously in a situation in which you cannot proceed is not fun. after playing for hours, i've gotten the magic combination one time. and, when i had this combo, i encountered a hazard i had not seen before and it instantly killed me, even though i had at least hearts remaining. as i said, i really want to recommend this game, but because of the poor upgrade system, it becomes more frustrating than fun.

i have this game for quite some time now, but never paid the proper attention to it. big mistake. mount amp blade warband is one of these games that will crave its place in the game universe by showing how awesome it can be by itself. you start as a nobody, with a horse and some gear. the objective is to gain power. you can achieve it by fighting and dealing working with lords and kings. what makes it special is how you work towards this goal. the mechanics are well developed placed, and i can't even recall a bug that me off enough to make me angry at the game. you can build your host by hiring villagers, join a kingdom for some benefits and work hard to replace the current king of said kingdom. if betrayal is not your game, you can join forces to attack other factions and deprive them frm lands and income. plenty of oportunities in this sandbox. if you are a next gen graphics lover, beware it will sure looks outdated. otherwise, if you like an engaging gameplay and the feeling of accomplishment, this is the game for you.

this is an excellent game. i went into it fully expecting it to be about the evils of government surveillance, and that you would see first hand the terrible effects and repercussions that it will bring. instead i got a very nuanced storyline that presented both sides of the issue, leaving you wondering afterwards if perhaps there is a practical middle ground that can be sought. the gameplay is also very addictive and unique, and there are several endings depending on your choices, with lots of little twists and turns. the game is very intelligent in regards to making your choices make a huge difference in the outcome, even if you think the ones you pick are not that important in the grand scheme of things. one of the best titles i played this past year. highly recommended.

bosses are overpowered. the ranking system is a joke. you mean to tell me that the longer i take to fight a boss, the less experience points i receive? i got exp from the ing manawar. it feels like there is little incentive to progress in this game. the ability to change your spells is simple, but not convenient when you're in a fight trying to execute combos and you accidentally pull up your spell menu and change two of your spells. this game is as engaging as it is disengaging. if you never play this game, you're not missing out.

get to play as a maverick cop who doesn't play by the rules but gets the job done. he also happens to be the big bad wolf. i recently completed this game for the second time after finishing it last year and, although some of the twists were still fairly fresh in my memory, i still enjoyed it. if there is one thing telltale do well is create a great atmosphere to tell a compelling story i guess that is where they got their name from and the wolf among us certainly does that in spades. the music is eerie, the artwork immaculate and the voice acting is spot on. after playing this game and re-reading the graphic novels i couldn't help but hear the voices in the dialogue. the choices, whilst don't actually have a great deal of consequence, still feel tense and still have a more noticable effect than other ttg titles. if you want great storytelling and compelling characters then this 'game' is perfect for you.

this game is so freaking cool and i'm not normally into this genre of games. it's as if tron, audio surf, asteroid, and ikaruga all had a child together. symphony has interesting visuals, great difficulty ramping and progression, the game teaches you how to play by you actually playing the game, every song you play will have its own uniquely generated level, and it's a great time killer if you're waiting inbetween matches on other games. you can import all of your own music from any folder on any drive of your computer, including external. when this game goes on sale, consider it a steal, there's a lot of value to be found here and i'm glad i got it.

this really is an addicting strategy game, and one of the best i've ever played. it has an interesting gameplay system and a fun multiplayer section. while it may be an old game by now, it still has the useful replayable feature. pros - addicting, and the urge to keep playing in order to win is always there. - different playstyles as different people, according to how you want to play. - mods section which allows you to customize your game using the steam workshop. cons - ai which can be really irksome, especially in the multiplayer section. leave them for minutes and all your money's gone. - a tutorial system would be really handy, as for some new players it can be hard to get used to. overall i would give this game a out of , as while it can be fun to play, there are still some features that need some work.

a very basic vertical scrolling shoot em up that relies heavily on memes and throwing random things at you as its main feature. the controls are okay, there is no variation in enemies or even bosses as all normal enemies just come vertically down the screen, nothing fires at you. the bosses are a bit different in the stay on screen until destroy and wobble about trying to back you into a corner with the normal enemies that keep coming during the boss fights. each stage will have a new shaped enemy and boss but the all behave the same way throughout the game, so there is little variation. there are a few different bonuses to pick up - allowing you to fly faster, shooter faster or triple shot, etc., but apart from that there is no real depth here, and nothing really to recommend it unless you are easily amused by the memes randomness thrown at you.

breaking is fun. i have no clue if the story is good or not. it may be a masterpiece written by a descendant of shakespear. no idea. as soon as you put hammer to wall in this game, all else fades away. the environmental damage system is the best i've ever seen. it's so satisfying to break down walls of a building until it finally falls. or just to drive a truck through a village. through the village. the last time i saw a damage system that was even a smidge on the same level was way back in carmageddon and . it's basically a gta style game so you can very easily be distracted by what's going on in the world.. and then breaking whatever it is that's going on in the world.

i like cod games and really wanted to like iw. i pre ordered and hoped for the best. sadly horrific 'mouse acceleration' made both iw and mw unplayable. my mouse slips all over the place making online play impossible. iw has 'terrible time to kill'. gun fights are over in a split second. most players simply hip-fire to avoid being killed and the game lacks any tactics because of this. the community for cod on pc is small due to these deliberate bugs within the game. out of ..i wanted to like it, but the deliberate mouse bug has ruined the whole game for me and many many others.

while i would reccomend this game for it's story, beautiful graphics even on lowest settings and amazing mechanics, i can not write a review where ii suggest in confidence to buy this game. first off, if you do not have an intel nvidia rig, it will run like absolute garbage. their promises with the optimization patches have so far gone without action. plus, whenever i fight a group of non infected people, before i can even land a kill, i lose the ability to sprint, throw weapons, attack, aim in, and kick. i have lost countless survivor points because of this ridiculous and farcical flaw. i have to quit the game every time it happens which is far too often for my taste and most of the time, this happens where rias's men show up. air drops. this bug intrudes on some of the major points of this games gameplay, ruining the experience genuinely for whoever this happens to. now, i'll never know what the game is fully like in the higher levels, seeing as though i'm missing all my survivor points because of a gaping, erroneous flaw.

the most aggrivating game i've played all year. the combat is so dodgy and wonky, it is not uncommon to get randomly shot and killed instantly by freshly spawned enemies as youre making your way through the linear storyline, and with checkpoints being roughly minutes apart usually, its annoying at best. i thought this game would be open world, the only open world experience you get in this is when you drive around town with your speedlimiter on because cops are everywhere going from chapter mission to chapter mission. what i personally found the absolute most irritating was that you lose your cash times in the game, as scripted with no way to stop this . it does have pretty good graphics for such an old game. but if you're too dumb to find breasts on the internet, you can always collect the playboy magazines in the game scattered as collectibles. stay away from this, even in a sale the community will defend this title to the death because 'story' and while i do admit it has a rather well done story, it does not make the game good.

i cannot recommend this game at the current price tag.. as with all musou games clones spin offs etc. gameplay is extremely repetitive. it started really nicely with a dragon boss in the beginning, which tickled a little bit of monster hunter in me but quickly got replaced by mundane less cool looking behaving mobs which i had to plow through.. game has a some combat depth with dodging and blocking but it is totally wrecked by a huge amount of enemies on the levels. i would have prefered more exploration and slower less 'flashy' combat.. i mean the assets are there. cool characters, graphics, design of weapons etc. but it doesn't keep my attention for long because its a shallow experience.. its a shame really.. it's not a dungeon experience which i hoped for this game to have but its a dynasty warriors clone with a different skin on it. you find one combo that works spam it till the end of the day get some chinese buns to recover health because u can find plenty on the battlefield so u dont need to dodge or block too much..

nice quality art. the included digital dakimakura enticed me to purchase this version for the play length, there were a decent amount of cgs with many variations - plot is very simple, but doesn't go anywhere is not explored in depth - refreshing personality for an otome mc tsundere princess who does exhibit growth. most people would probably find her annoying, however she outshined any other character. - pretty short with only routes. the card drops took longer than completing the entire game - romance felt flat. the male love interests have no depth. - the first version of this game was free and voiced. i played that version before they removed it i might recommended this if it were on sale and you need another basic otome game in your catalog. i decided not to recommend this because i do not like winged cloud's actions as a company. they treated their other otome game, 'guardian's spell' and it's kickstarter backers so poorly that it has left a negative impression on me.

every now ad then i still play this title even though i find it incredibly frustrating to play. the only reason why i do is because i purchased the season pass, so i feel obligated to play when the new content releases. i feel that trials evolution was the pinnacle to this franchise. the tracks aren't nearly as fun to play in fusion. the fmx tracks are a joke and would have been an addition that should have been subtracted. to say that i enjoy playing them would be the same as anyone saying they love a mouth full of cavities. i suggest that if you want to play a great trials game then please pick up evolution. or grab any tablet and play frontier that one is actually a ton of fun .

charming platform puzzle game. most puzzles involve changing between two characters to help each other progress each stage. between the puzzles and narration, gameplay was simply a lot of walking right and jumping. the story was very simple but cute. the artistic effects were also well done for an indie game. however, controls were very sluggish and there were times where i got frustrated by responsiveness when turning and jumping. foxtale dlc was very short.. and introduced two new mechanics, one of which was paddling which quickly turned into a chore. the other was simply picking up stuff and throwing it. story again was very simple and short. very short dlc. out of . overall never alone has a lot of charm in it's story and characters.. but fails to deliver in the gameplay. . out of

a brilliant, beautiful puzzle game that's all about perspective, careful observation of the environment around you, and thinking outside the box. the thoughtful craftsmanship of every element of gameplay mechanics and overall concept is really impressive, alongside the gorgeous world design. having a pencil and note paper at hand is strongly recommended. important there is no 'storyline' in this game. it's purely about discovering puzzles and accumulating the knowledge you need to solve them by exploring the island. if simply the reward of working out solutions to puzzles isn't enough reason for you to play this type of game, then you may find your enjoyment of the witness lacking.

rayman legends is a thing of beauty! if you ever enjoyed d platform gaming like super mario bros, or donkey kong country you simply can't go wrong with this game. i would even go so far as to say this game is better. the controls are very fluid and soon become second nature. which is just as well because after a few easy introductionary levels the difficulty picks up. it's all very nicely balanced, though. levels that may seem impossible at first become feasible and you'll find yourself zipping through them. the feeling of satisfaction when you're conquering another world is a joy. the tunes are memorable. you'll find yourself humming them. the graphics are poetry in motion. check the trailer and you'll see what i mean. if there's any drawback to this game i have well over hours playtime in this and my kids and about hours between them it's the lack of a coherent story. but really, who needs a story to a game like this? princess toadstool has been kidnapped by bowser time and time again without any formal complaint. if you're into platformers, grab this game! you won't be disappointed.

it's tough to recommend this game unless you really like these 'twitchy arcade' style games. i wanted to know what all the fuss was about and picked hotline miami up when it was cheap. i completed the main story and i guess i'm missing something, i don't see what's so special about it. the soundtrack is great, and the look and feel of the game is its' own. my biggest complaint is how ridiculous the controls are and how unavoidable and frustrating the mechanics are during boss encounters. you'll also run into deaths that are not brought on by difficulty and they are completely out of your control. ex. an enemy you can't even see on screen will be able to take you out from across the map. melee weapons not connecting with ai on occassions. instead of the game being difficult, it seems to just come down to how lucky you are and if all the ai are lined up just right. don't pay full price for hotline miami unless you really like these types of games. pick it up when it goes on sale if you're really wanting to try it out.

out of i've always been a fan of the total war francise and i'm pretty sure everyone was disapointed by rome . and yes, attila is basically the same setting as rome barbarian invation. but the game itself is actually fairly decent with almost all problems from rome fixed. there are of course some drawbacks, such as the lack of multiple voices in the game in diplomacy, as well as a limited amount of actual factions to play as. plus having to pay to get more factions through the dlcs? that was bs, move ca. all in all the game isnt so bad providing new features and a major graphics boost, as well as fun gameplay and the return of the family tree. i would recommend it to any total war fan, but shogun is still my favorite

crayon physics is a sandbox where you draw objects and have the physics engine move them around. the game aspect of it is that there are levels where you need to get a ball to touch the stars in a level. as a game, crayon physics fails on most levels. it's far too easy, and the same solutions work on most of the puzzles, making it very repetitive. the music and sound is very basic. 'winning' crayon physics is as boring as it is pointless. as a physics sandbox, it's too basic for my tastes. i'm sure there are cool things you can do, but they would take far too much effort to do with the limited toolbox you're given. why can't we make motors? i'd love that. or at least make the ropes actually work. or maybe i'm missing something.. the tutorial is amazingly bad. if you want to draw cool stuff and watch it go, then sure, pick up crayon physics. i'll spend the time playing games instead. either way, do not spend on this.. wait until it's on sale.

a very stylish steampunk-ish dystopian first-person stealth shooter that kept reminding me of the half-life thief deus ex series as i played. beautiful character models and animation, good level design, impressive voice acting susan sarandon, john slattery, brad dourif, michael madsen!! , and pretty decent gameplay. story starts out strong but ends abruptly and surprisingly weak - i get the impression that the devs didn't get to finish all they wanted to in time or that a fair amount of potential content was cut before release. getting it with the dlc is probably a good idea. works very well with keyboard and mouse - as you'd expect considering the format - but like many recent games, has some of that easy-mode console flavour. combat is tricky though, and the stealth can be inconsistently challenging. takes about hours to complete. quicksave often. glad to hear they're making a sequel.

don't let the graphics fool you, beneath its dull exterior lies a creamy center full of strategic goodness. strategies center around the nation you choose and how you design your pretender god. battles are decided by how you form up your troops and the orders you issue to them before each fight. if you like strategy games and a fantasy setting, you really should not pass this one up.

this is an rts. sorta.. more realistic than what i would believe a game should be. instead of the a-typical select units, tell units to go attack in a flank formation, command mid-battle to turn the tide, etc, etc- it's more of a system to entice your units into what you want them to do. you set a reward on a monster, and then put a bounty on it's head. that is an amazingly cool idea- but in practice it doesn't work out so well. i had set my flag, and set the bounty to . no one would go kill this monster.. i set the bounty to , nothing. finally around the more than a out of of all the money i had available mark someone wanted to try it. they promptly died, so one more decided to try it. they died. there isn't really a symbolence of strategy here as i watched each unit die to just one, the very first at that, monster. at , i finally got more than one unit to go and they spent more time running away together than fighting. and for out of of my kingdom- it was awful.

a married beatnick couple battle squares everywhere on both sides of the wall to get one of 'em outta jail and hopefully score the rumoured heist loot. bought on sale and with that in mind, i recommend it for fans of classic point and click adventuring. somewhat short i'd say less than hours on a decent 'check everything' playthrough , but well-written and entertaining most of the way through. easy and logical puzzles, so none of that 'put the frog in the mouth of your younger self on a park bench' a'la the first discworld game. there's no punishment for trying out the wrong things if something goes wrong, you'll be right back to 'just before making a wrong decision' , but the occasional saving is recommended as some parts present different solutions with slightly different outcome for the storyline. sure, there's some clunky animations and the occasional audio mishap, but nothing that detracts from neither gameplay nor atmosphere. if such things matter deeply to you, there's always the first zork game to keep you up at night. replay value is limited, but on the whole, i enjoyed the ride while it lasted.

such lush scenery in a nice, relaxing atmosphere all joking aside, if you are the kind of person who enjoys exploring environments, feeling the mood, the atmosphere, the visual and sound immersion and feel moving around in pretty landscapes is its own reward, regardless of whichever brownie points a game might give you for exploring, you will find this gratifying. i just.. definitely did not expect getting creeped out as often as i did, neither from the screenshots nor from the reviews. but it's very mild, even for someone like me who gets scared extremely, embarrassingly easily, and it does add to the experience. there is a lot of detail and thought put into processing things with your senses. i found it surprising how well the game manages to communicate other types of sensory input via sight and sound only for instance, looking at directly at the sun is very uncomfortable and something you'll find yourself avoiding doing, same with messing with a swarm of bees. the transitions in sound are very subtle yet effective, and feels like part of a coherent whole. if feeling an environment isn't your thing, don't buy it. otherwise it's worth it.

i have had a love for trains since i was a child and own a few different versions of train simulator, along with other train games, but i have to say, i am a bit annoyed at the design of this current game. i am the type of person to explore and then create my own world with these games, but i was a bit shocked at the way the current game operates. the graphics and sound, scenarios, and overall gameplay is fine, but do i need to see advertisements when loading, do i need to have scenarios show up and then tell me to buy them? sure, its fine to promote dlc, but do it in a sub menu or somewhere else. i feel like i purchased advertisment spam more than a game. now comes editing. seriously need to rework the key bindings here and make it a default for zoom to the mouse scroll. arrow keys vs. the wasd common movement assignments? really! i'm sorry, but honestly i can't see myself enjoying this version over previous ones. i hope my opinion changes as i play, but first impressions leave it a bit low..

this is not a negative review, i just really do not recommend buying it as it currently is. this game is great, it is a lot of fun and has so much replayability. the this is though the networking and servers for this game are terrible. it takes way too long to join a game and once you are in one you better hope the host doesn't leave. not only that the nat settings are crazy, i had to forward so many ports for this game to work and now for some reason. even though i have changed nothing, my nat setting is back to 'strict' instead of 'open' meaning i can not play online. edit out of - to be able to get your nat type from strict to open you must go into your router settings everytime you want to play and disable and re-enable upnp. on a side note, not very many people play terrorist hunt mode anymore, some still do but on normal difficulty only. there are still plenty of people who play online however.

very good game! first the graphics are really nice! the are some really good textures, especially for the main characters. i really liked the story! a good twist and lots of cool encounters and surprises. the combat system is very interesting, because it is a 'one button' combat system with blocking that seems really simplistic, but when you stop smashing the attack button and start to aim where you are attacking it takes you to a whole other level of depth. i got a solid hours, without searching for all the collectibles, challenges, and resolving riddles. so if you add on all that you swing around h to hours of good gameplay! i recommend this game to all fans of batman!

painfully easy and repetitive, save for a few encounters. which is really disappointing, because the game, while quite simple in it's mechanics, has potential to be a very engaging strategy game. yet most of the time the game chooses just to throw piles of weak monsters at you which you have to slog trough without using half of a brain cell. another thing that really makes this game painful to play is that it has a bunch of unnecessary dice rolls outside combat - travel, rest, investigate.. all of these unnecessarily slow down the game without providing anything to it. i can't even recommend this as a time-sink game for your tablet or other low-powered device. additionally, while not a direct criticism to the game, i've been noticing a trend of games trying to mask poor gameplay by filling the game with humour and pop-culture references. and this game really tries hard to seem hip and cool, which just leaves a bad taste while playing it..

'shantae and the pirate's curse' is the latest and best game released of the shantae series so far . join shantae as she teams up with the pirate risky boots to stop the spread of an ancient curse. use various pirate equipment and sail on a pirate ship as you explore several islands in sequin land. battle monsters, upgrade weapons and search labyrinths for rare treasures and items. like the previous installment, the game stands out with great music, beautiful art, solid controls, lovable characters and a memorable story that never takes itself too seriously. note that it has more content than the previous games, including an unlockable 'pirate mode', multiple endings and enough achievements to challenge even hardcore players. the only significant flaw is the lack of transformation magic and sexy dances due to the events of the previous game. i highly recommend 'shantae and the pirate's curse' to anyone who enjoys platformers like castlevania or metroid. definitely look forward to the release of the next shantae game!

i just got done watching this movie, literally seconds ago. i had been told repeatedly, 'oh you gotta watch this movie, it's amazing. it'll change the way you view indie games.' i didn't expect those people to be as right as they were. this movie is about so many things. it's about making indie games, and about indie games in general. it's also about so much more. it allows you to see the rollercoaster of emotion that developers like edmund mcmillen had to go through, all the stress they had to put up with and how rewarded they were at how their game was received. it's about what was important to them about the game and how much of an extension of themselves the games really were. it's about what inspired them to do what they did, all the blood, sweat and tears that they put into their work. it gave me a indescribable amount of respect for these people and what they do, and it really touched me emotionally on several occasions throughout the movie. ing watch this movie, you won't regret it.

gorgeous art, disappointing gameplay. the game play is a tedious and unrewarding slog with no heart. i was expecting a zelda-like experience, as promised, but this is not zelda or even zelda-like except in the broadest possible interpretation it might have worked better as a point-and-click puzzle adventure, or a jrpg, than a sort-of-maybe-kind-of 'platformer'. i truly wish the game had turned out better given i helped kickstart it. if you can steel yourself enough to put up with the game play, the art is indeed stunning, and the music is beautiful if repetitive --with these the developers met and exceeded expectations.

this was an interesting idea for a game but it just didn't really come together for me. this is in the visual novel choose your adventure style with no way to lose the game, just variations on what happens. the comic art style is interesting but not especially pleasing to look at. the story is decent, but it feels like it was translated either in a hurry or by someone who has an incomplete grasp of english. also, once you've gone through the story once, the variations are really pretty minor on subsequent playthroughs. none of the endings resonated with me. achievement hunting is fun at first, but some are way to easy to miss and replaying the game is difficult because you can't skip text you've already seen, or even cycle through it quickly. i'm missing two and it bothers my ocd but i just can't click another times to advance text.

i remember my days as a kid, i had just gotten a new copy of heroes of might and magic iii, even back then that game was old. but for me it was a new fresh experience that i'd never had before, it took me about a month to reliase that i could end the turn and didn't have to make a new game each time i'd finished my moves, but when i reliased this i suddently got really into the game, i spent almost years playing that game non-stop.. ever since i've been looking for something similar, and age of wonders iii is probably the best fantasy x game i've played in recent years, it succeeds in fullfilling my nostalgia with homm and i couldn't be more happy that i bought it. a strong recommend for anyone that is even slightly interested in x games with a focus on combat, hero customization and exploring.

i once considered this game to be of my favorite games. the graphics are tight, the game play is amazingly fun, its one of the few games on the the market that are actually play to win, and the community was fairly supportive of new players and allowed everyone to get in on the fun. but things have changed. the community is now for the most part dead and i swear that they moved all their severs to china because no matter how many games i join the lag is ever present. team deathmatch? get shot by someone as i run into a building but i dont die from it till i'm rooms in. fumigation? the canister dosen't start to be captured until about seconds of me standing around with a huge sign on my face that says shoot me!! and im not the only one with this problem too. read some of the reviews below me. until they fix this game breaking issue i'm removing this game from my library and you should reconsider adding it to yours.

this game got dumped on by a lot of critics when it came out, and not without reason. magic is gimpy, and the most powerful tactic by far is kicking dudes into pointy things. however, the fact remains that no game has ever made first person melee combat feel so good or so smooth, not even zeno clash. it's also one of the few games that effectively combines action and stealth gameplay, so that both approaches seem worthwhile, even using both if you've spent your skillpoints appropriately. just do yourself a favor and don't bother with hardcore mode. it makes all humanoid enemies and possibly spiders invincible unless you knock them down and hit them with a coup de grace, which makes combat incredible tedious.

the graphics may be good in this game but, to be brutally honest, this may be passed as one of those ipad games you give to your year old to keep them occupied. even then there's not much going on on screen to keep them interested. as previewed in the freaking trailer it's literally a plane going back and forth across the screen and dropping bombs on buildings, almost like a reverse space invaders. that might sound cool but when have you looked at those things and thought they would provide riviting gameplay? you can't even move the plane on your own so the only thing you have to do is wait for your plane to fly over some buildings and spam left click. in the style of old, crappy nes games, it also provides a quite annoying loop of a soundtrack. overall, this game is only slightly more thought provoking than following a laser light around the room. ps. the graphics may be good but that doesn't mean the art style is. ie. this monstrosity

an excellent port of the classic guilty gear reload fight game, arcade, mom, mission mode, survival mode, training mode are all there. probably my favourite fighting game of all time, i only prefer the slash version to this because it's the most balanced. the muiltplayer is also good as long as you play with people above ping. there is a decent sized community, it's not huge but you can generally find a match if you're patient. much better than the ac r port, the netcode for that game at this moment is really bad reload continues to remain the best on-line ggxx at the moment.

matchmaking is bad and inbalanced. you can find yourself in a match with only infantry troops agains tanks, planes, paratroopers. everything cost a lot and you dont much, so cleary designed as a p w. it cost to have a new character, to switch class, to buy new weapons, new upgrades, new vehicules. also, one of the worst points is the individual progression of each character. each character you buy dont share unlock. and if you previously buy a gun, you need to unlock it again and buy it again. add to it my previous argument, it become a pain. it may still be a beta, but it is one of the worst war game i played.

ok, it's clear that this game should not have been released so early. the game is riddled with bugs, the textures look like still images taken from the ship. the fact that you die if the water touches your chin is annoying there should be a swimming breathing mechanic, it would make the game so much more enjoyable. speaking of enjoyable, i didn't enjoy it. the only enjoyable moment was when i pretended i was the 'king of the world'. the ship was terribly laid out, with walls and doors that make no sense, so it made it frustrating to navigate. the fov was way to tight, couple that with the blurry textures and frame drops, well you might just throw up. so the tl dr is buy it if you want to pretend you're the 'king of the world' or just don't bother. i did make a video on it, if you care to give it a watch. i would appreciate it.

review changed since release. when it first came out on steam, this game had less polish than the cossack hetmanate in the s. luckily, the developers have been releasing pacthes rushingly, so it might just become a great game, if they don't fall into the mistakes of other indie devs, that is, abandoning their project once it made enough money. regarding this, the game is free to play but borders on pay to win. it's still enjoyable if you don't buy stuff, but you'll be accordingly less weaker. the combat system is easy to learn and difficult to master. some might enjoy it, some not. give it a try and see if it pleases your palate.

for the curious blood bowl is a turn-based tactical combat game, loosely based around american football, played with the fantasy races from warhammer, and with x-com style persistent characters. they gain skills, injuries, death. it's a gorgeous, rules-perfect nit-picks aside adaptation of the -year-old board game. it is goofy and stupid and fun while also providing quite a bit of strategic depth, if you have the stomach for dice-rolling and don't get too attached to your players . i have sunk entirely too many hours into this game.

a clicker game that tries too hard to be innovative. lots of its design choices are questionable and the system has little explination. items have no explination except for a little vague hastag blurb, only one follower at a time, no idle system, and the fact that you need to save gold to buy keys to move forward in the game. overall the game feels very unrewarding and confusing and you're better off playing another free clicker on steam.

i want this game to be good, i was hoping it would be enough to take the place of dragon's prophet, but nexon had to do their thing. this game is plagued by horrifically slow main content updates fixes, and an over abundance of cash shop updates. we waited months for the level cap increase, meanwhile nexon was adding plushie familiar skins to the cash shop. we waited for fixes, slogging through fps drops, disconnects, latency spikes, meanwhile nexon gave us exclusive skins only available from loot boxes. we tried to get spammers removed, meanwhile bored afk familiar levellers were being banned. now there is no chat, there is no community, only the echoes of 'fast cheap gold at xxxxxx!'. if you think you can handle the solo mmo experience, and the knowledge that all public chat channels are used exclusively by spammers, then by all means give it a shot. however after all i've witnessed, i cannot recommend this game.

perhaps evoland will be better but this game coasted off of kitchy video game references and very little substance. the game has one or two zones that are actually interesting zelda-like puzzles, but abruptly shifts gears and the game ends. good ideas and amusing gameplay. runs out of steam very quickly.

ok - i made it through about out of of this game and really wanted to like it. however i just got bored. its clearly a homage to the might and magic series similar ideas to world of xeen however you are better off just playing that series rather than this game. there is no animation, no voice, very few npcs - the world is pretty bland and lifeless. i understand that its the product of a small shop however it didn't capture my interest. you pretty much use the same battle tactics over and over while progressing through a pretty shallow story grinding away through levels. playing this actually inspired me to go back to an old might and magic game for another playthrough. the quality of those games still shines today. my advice - if you want a grid based crawler like this game, just go play the best might and magic games . gog has them running nicely on modern machines.

i loved the first portal, so once i heard that valve was releasing a second game i knew that i'd have to save up my pennies and grab the second iteratino eventually. and i can say that if you loved the first portal, then the second will be just as lovable. witty dialogue, humorous situations, mind bending puzzles, a decent length of a story mode, challenges to complete, and now a co-op mode that isn't dumbed down from the single-layer or worse, a dumbed down single-player experience that is only a training mode for online play. my only qualm with this game is that if you don't have a robust friends list then a few of the achievements are unattainable without going all over the place to fora to hopefully find someone that hasn't yet played but other than that no gripes here.

intro as a longtime rts fan returning to computer gaming after a five-year hiatus, this hits all the right notes. pros campaign is short and enjoyable great casual multiplayer distinct factions with hordes minimal micromanagement economy straightforward with interesting options great interface short matches very well designed low system reqs cons not flavourful- sides are rather generic but really, so is classic gdi renegade campaign can drag too many missions best with -bit hordes game and guardians campaign dlc for a total of summary for a casual rts experience, this is a great one. if you want a fun, arcade-y rts game that's more about having fun than memorizing current metas, this is the game for you. clearly made by rts veterans with lessons learned from two decades of rts games. out of all the games i've played, this ranks up with dawn of war dark crusade as my favorite rts games of all time. rts background sc all sp, dabbled in pvp , aoe series, wc , supreme commander, sotse,dow, coh, sc bw, ta

i can only recommend banished. it is exactly what i want from a city building simulation. no superficial enemies, no fantasy elements. just the challenge of building and maintaining a working infrastructure. the gameplay is strangely soothing while stressing you out at the same time without throwing obvious stress situations at you. there are no events except for catastrophes that try shaping your game leaving only the ultimate goal, survival. you build what you want and soon enough you will have created your own problems to take care of. if hits the fan there is no safety net. no one to hold your hand as you watch the decent of your town. nothing to fall back on except your own creativity in problem solving or crushing defeat. i see myself sinking many more hours into this before getting tired of it and will certainly need that time to polish my building strategies.

i'm a huge, huge fane of the original x-com. i was really looking foward to this game and hoped an indie company could restore the glorius gameplay that was x-com -- but they fall short. they really try to be true to the source material, but nothing quite meshes. graphics and animations are meh and the a.i. still makes those magical shots from yards away, around the tree, under the car, through the two house windows -- killing your soldier instantly. on the other end of the spectrum, you will miss the alien standing next to you, with a plasma shot gun and cth -- and if you are lucky enough to hit it, it will take a whopping damage, while the other of your soldiers will panic, drop their gun, and run right up to the enemies for a merciful quick killing. it's very frustrating, to say the least. so close, but so far.

i say a lot of games are 'the best' on my recommendations. well. this game isn't the best at a few things. my gripes are game length at about five hours for the main story, the ammo mechanics you need to pickup the same weapon on the ground to reload, or execute someone , and some of the cover physics got stuck occasionally, sometimes you vaulted over an obstacle instead of ran to cover . the story makes this game awesome. the story makes this 'the best' third person or first person shooter for folks who actually like a bit of plot and background to their games. it is a fun journey, feeling a lot like a modern apocalypse now. the twists and turns along the way are interesting and feel fresh in the setting that you find yourself in. major fanboy bonus points for bruce boxleitner being one of the main characters in the game. he's got the perfect voice for the role he plays.

this is a great rail shooter. amazing visuals, and fast, fluid gameplay ok, it kind of feels like cheating to use a mouse in this game.. . and the story? talk about completely ridiculous, and absolutely hilarious. in fact, you should play this game just for the story. only problem i have with it is when it ended, i was seriously left thinking really? that's it? it doesn't wrap up its story very well, and is practically begging for a sequel, or dlc, or something that will wrap up the loose ends.

do you like left dead ? do you wish the zombies were instead policemen with assault rifles? then you've found the right game! just be sure to land in a lobby with experienced players, otherwise things will go a bit south rather quickly, regardless of the difficulty you're in. i enjoyed playing payday . the mechanics aren't as sharp as counterstrike but it gets the job done regardless. the music that kicks in when 'it' hits the fan makes my ears bleed a bit, but it's easy to turn off to allow for total concentration, which you will need. the graphics are adequate and hold up well enough, though there are a lot of blurry textures. if you do notice the textures though, that means that you stopped to smell the roses, which means that the cops broke in through the other window, your teammates are down, it's all your fault, and now you've been kicked. way to go, you. for even more details, check out my concise video review below

such neat ideas, but it controls terribly for mouse keyboard and just decently for a gamepad. the controls are clearly made for a flight-stick. the tutorial is not voiced and is not comprehensive or part of a campaign story to introduce the game world to you, and combat is tiresome instead of exciting. the starting vehicle, at least, turns so slowly that dog-fighting in it is ridiculous. the other problem i have is that it delights in minutia that other games automate for you like parking at a station or scanning a system. i'm sure there is an audience that enjoys this game, but i'm looking for a successor to games like privateer - not a tarted up x . maybe star citizen won't crawl so far up hardcore flight-sim fans bottoms that it is unapproachable to the rest of us or maybe this will become more approachable and less of a risk to take a gamble on with a lower price in the future. but for now, i'm definitely not keeping it.

honestly an amazing game. great story, great character design, fun multiplayer. with better marketing and not launching at the same time as overwatch it could be a lot more successful. for people wondering whether to get this or overwatch, know that battleborn is nothing like overwatch. it's more like a cross between monday night combat and borderlands. aside from the low player base, the only real issue i have with it is screen clutter. the animations are pretty, but they're all over the place. hard to tell what's going on at first until you start to get the hang of it. i recommend buying it because please we need more people in matchmaking!! although if that sounds like a dealbreaker, you can still play a full singleplayer campaign

this game is an incredible mmorpg. its very smooth compared to some of the mmorpgs i have played and the character creation is amazing. the character creation doesn't just end when you start playing either it continues on throughout the game as you can choose what you wear. say you have one item for example gods boob plate and it looked badass as hell. then you go another item called satans boobplate which had much greater stats but horrible looks. you can equip satans boobplate but still have the look of gods boobplate. you can also change the colour of the armour as much as you like without paying for dyes or paying real money. it isnt really a pay to win game more of a pay to get better asthetics which is what an mmorpg should be. the only downside i have with the game is how big the game is. like holy hell its something like gb. to be honest it is one of the best mmos i have ever played and its worth the wait of downloading. i rate from personal experiences . out of

so i heard this game has great story with a deep philosophical angle that makes you think, well perhaps this served as a bit of a spoiler that the final reveal really lacked the impact i was hoping for, what i got is a generic at best shooter with very boring standard mechanic and linear corridors, the story is really just average, tho better than the 'doesnt even make sense' or 'the dev didnt even try to make a coherent story' level of quality of most of the shooters out there, this game fails the hype it enjoyed, if you enjoy shooting waves after waves of ai enemy in a linear corridor single player campaign youd prbbly enjoy it with a multiplayer no one plays thus of value , coupled with a 'something is at least better than nothing' plot and character, i understand how this game could stand out, so a from the out of average score i'd give, making it overall a out of generic shooter that i cant think of any reasons to recommend.

my grievances - bad music please just pick a musical mood and stick with it. - graphically unimpressive - poor physics and exploits i've been able to 'crush myself' by hitting my head against the bottom of a physics block while jumping. also, crates can roll around on the useless voxel residue 'gibs' of a crushed corpse. - game actually has to have good physics before implementing weird, floating, frustrating physics blocks. - i've seen the concept before 'squishy the suicidal pig' on top of this, the game can hardly be considered fun. it's just a bit of a chore. pro - cool color palatte and background design basically, i believe the game has few redeeming qualities, which are inadequate to actually redeem it.

's across the board. i have to say i wasn't too sure about this game, it looked interesting but it seemed like i would get bored with it pretty quickly, i even considered pirating it first, but then bought it on impulse and omg was it worth it. it is so much fun, stacking up and breaching rooms honestly never gets old. if you're like me and are an avid arma player, tactical shooter and strategy fan, this game is right down your alley. it reminds me a lot of the old police quest swat games. i hope to see a breach and clear someday with the ability to rope down from a ceiling or helicopter, use a seperate sniper team as support, as well as the ability to use chagres on walls, and also stack up multiple times during a mission. that being said i still love this game and see a lot of potential for future titles. ps. the music is fantastic.

i've been waiting for this for years, i like how you are thrown into the game without a tutorial, you just have to figure everything out for yourself. spent the first hours exploring the first planet, going from one point of interest to the next thinking 'eh, just this last one'. when i finally changed planet, i stumbled across one that looks just like earth, but with blue grass, and couldn't help but find the highest mountain to climb to just see how beautiful it looked. performance issues are a problem, i haven't had any crashes, but fps are very unstable, they are above fps most of the time for me, but will stutter frequently. i noticed a couple of audio bugs on a couple of planets as well. also the spaceship controls feel very wonky to me, especially the sensitivity and controlling the ship with the mouse. i'm sure they'll fix everything, after all, it is a very small team and are working like crazy.

this is a review about the rockstar social club and how it s not working with steam. the game itself is very well made and i enjoyed it alot. it s like playing a movie. the rockstar social club sadly screws the whole experience completley. i recently reinstalled my computer and i can t play max payne anymore. you are forced to log into your rockstar social club account in order to play this game, but after reinstalling the game it doesn t work anymore. you can t even make a new account, changing the password wont help, in fact nothing will help. the game is just unplayable like this. not because of bugs but because you simply can t even start it. wouldn t recommend this game to anyone that wants to play it more than just once and is probably reinstalling the computer in between. it s actually sad that such a big company can t fix a problem like this. please don t sell games on steam if they won t work properly with steam. sorry if i mispelled some words or stumbled across the tenses, not a native speaker and stuff.

i found ebf to be a light and adorable old-timey style rpg with a good sense of humor. gameplay should be familiar to anyone with jrpg experience, and many of the jokes refer to classic titles. plenty of 'quests' on which you can go, and lots of achievements to unlock. i enjoyed the soundtrack very much. found the enemy-strengthening curve to be not what i expected and at first a bit annoying, but in retrospect i thought it was appropriate and provided a good challenge. only possible downsides in my opinion are length of play and replayability. i prefer to be casual with my gaming these days, and this provided a weeked of cute, nostalgic fun. you can pick it up and put it down at your own pace since you can save anywhere. if you want something a little longer and more involved this may not be your favorite. not sure if it will have much replay value, but completely worth a free download.

this game has too many faults to ever be good. physics are highly inconsistent, npc ai is inconsistent. the ai always take corners wide and which inevitably leads to collisions. no matter how you try you always come out as the loser in any collision which means passing is a huge chore. passing is mandatory since you always start close to last place so you can't just stay out front. to top it off in touge matches collision equals disqualification, but if you are in the lead and the npc hits you you get disqualified not your opponent how does that make sense? one last quip that should scare all race fans away is that the npc cars occasionally get 'power ups' i've been in an identical car to the npc and watched them blow by me on a straightaway like they have nitrous.. how do you win when that happens? simple you can't. do not buy this game.

a retro inspired platformer so in love with its forebearers, that it copies all of the issues of ancient game design without bringing any of the good qualities with it. the most problematic is the damage knockback from old castlevania titles with flying enemies coming towards you in wave pattern, even! . by itself it's a welcome challenge but when added to the pile of unexplained, poorly tutored level features and instant death traps the game becomes an exercise in frustration. levels are compeletely filled with obstacles, with new hazards and dangers being introduced mere seconds before you already get hit or even die by them. there's no rhyme or reason to how levels are designed, rather it just seems as much as possible has been stuck together to create as much challenge as possible, without any thought brought to how all these challenges are presented to the player.

when i wrote my review for fallout , i feel i was too jaded. i still stand by my arguments as people should be more critical of bethesda, yet i think modern standards have made them appear less impressive with time. i wanted to revisit the tes games as i feel their exploration, rpg, and lore elements are what bethesda excels in this series. oblivion seemed the most obvious first choice as it paved the way of a wrpg standard. morrowind's dice-roll system and other design decisions make it too archaic. i'm not saying it's bad it's simply a different experience. what i did not expect to come away with was my utter contempt for bethesda by their lack of quality control with their past games. it is simply inexcusable to be ignored as, 'oh, it's bethesda what did you expect?' damned if you mod and damned if you don't

more parts are on their way, but in the current state, it's not worth the full ten dollars. i completed it without tutorials in less than three hours, and i lack the common sense to solve most puzzles without heavy pondering. here's an actual review for you in this game, you are a.r.i.d., an ai helping an unconcious piot to safety by controlling his mechanical suit. all this game really boils down to is a point-and-click adventure game with some short combat sequences, from a side-scrolling perspective. the atmosphere is well-made, but i feel a majority of the puzzles are a bit too open-ended for one, you have to jump underneath a ten-foot-wide elevator where the only control panel for it is on the elevator itself . again, it's not worth it in its current state. i may change my review when more content is added. there is a twilight zone-caliber ending, though.

entertaining for a few play sessions, but not enough truly unique content to justify the pricetag. 'infinite' play area via procedural generation doesn't cut it without interesting gameplay. never going to pre-order anything again, so dissapointed. i also feel mislead by the developers marketing - no multiplayer came as a shock. there is so much about the gameplay that is inexplicably missing or simply bad. lack of planet maps, for one. or they buried the capability somewhere i couldn't find it. the fuel for pulse drive being everywhere in the universe. if they didn't want us to get stranded, then remove the fuel requirement. don't litter space with tons of the mineral everywhere. cluttered and boring. what i did like hunting down alien words and slowly becoming better at understanding them. that was fun, roaming around looking for ruins and artifacts. but it's not enough to keep me playing. at this point it doesn't matter, as it seems pretty obvious after hours of playtime there is all to do beyond what i've already done. oh well, can't get a blockbuster title every time we pay a blockbuster price i guess..

so, here's the thing. i have cortex command. i play it a fair amount. it's got some fun elements. so, why the negative review? this game never really finished development. the game was very very cool as a concept when it was first released, but the ui is as bad as it has always been, there are frequent bugs, winning is pretty formulaic v. ai, and there are severe problems with multi. the underlying concepts? fun. the implementation? still incomplete. felt like something that got rushed to release with some minor new releases once the creator got bored.

really fun game. i didn't have any idea what i was doing at first and loved it, then once i actually figured out how to play, i loved it even more. you have classes in this game gunner, pilot, and engineer. the gunner gets more ammo types than any of the other classes, the engineer gets more repair and buff tools, and the pilot gets the most piloting skills abilities they can activate while flying that have special effects, such as buffing the ship but damaging it or creating a giant smoke cloud . there are a fair variety of weapons for your ship like gattling guns, shotguns, sniping guns, medium-range flak cannons, and flamethrowers. each has its advantages and disadvantages. finding the right combo of gun and ammo type can be devastating to enemies. all in all this game is pretty awesome, though it can be a bit unstable and crash sometimes for me at least .

fun, gore, filled with dark humor, crazy settings and weapons. always wanted to love cats, never could. this game gave me a reason to love them. sadistic, yet so funny that i sometimes felt a little bad loving it so much. it's a goold old fashioned shooter, the way duke nukem was for my generation, yet more twisted than the games it takes inspiration from. if you're not afraid of blood, crude and dark humor, you must play this game. it's awesome for what it is and, hey, gary coleman is in there.

a rather short game, however the amount of detail in it is pleasing. at this point, from what i've played through so far, it's not really worth . i do love it though as it came free with fx-, however knowing what it is, wouldn't exactly pay full price. game itself has a lot of possible twists and things to uncover, which later help out or link with late-game missions. dialogue choices actaully makes massive difference in how you end or proceed with mission. replay value is pretty big but initially for lethal and non-lethal playthrough, that's if we're talking major difference between replays. there are a few missions where you have to make your choice meaning you can initially stick with your playstyle and still get different experience. recommended, just wait for sale.

at first glance this looks like a great game maker. but it's really a waste of money as of now, let me explain. do you know how the far cry lever editor you can script and build mountains. in gameguru you really have less things to do. this is a level editor. if you make games with this and then compare them, you would see how they are almost exactly alike. you will see buildings and models repeat over and over again. even if the games are different genres the game machcanics will just have a slight tweak. if the person you show this to doesnt know about gameguru, they would think dempending on how good the game is they would think it's quite ok. you are also stuck with basic models and store bought models. no customisation at all. on top of the price gameguru, you may have seen that i said ''store bought models''. that's because you can buy models, some times even in a pack, for some almost more than gameguru its self! so if you look into making a actual game and not just a level, don't buy this.

this game kept me entertained every hour that i played it. it is definitely worth playing. almost every action i did felt like it had impact, because the world of this game felt real, in its own crazy exaggerated way. the world is thoughtfully crafted and amazing to look at and drive through the storms alone are fantastic . the characters are a little forced, but i loved them all anyways. the combat is brutal and involving, though the 'boss' fights are all very similar and easy. i hated for it to end, and honestly hated the ending, not because it was bad, but because of what happened.. you need to see it yourself. i had a lot of doubts for this game after seeing the movie, but this game was amazing. for example, i got mgsv and this at the same time. after putting around hours into each, i just left mgsv alone. mad max was so much more interesting and adrenaline fueled. if you're on the edge, i say buy the game. if you love gritty worlds and extremely satisfying car and land battles, it's worth it.

absolutely fantastic game! as a fan of detective shows and movies, this game was perfect for putting me into the action as a detective. though there are a considerable number of cutscenes, you really feel like you are in the action when solving cases. from searching for clues, to determining whether someone is lying based on their facial expressions, this is by far a great game if you want to experience the life of a detective.

i've never been all that into tower defense games. and i don't think i'll get into them anytime soon. but this game? this game is so much more. it combines tower defense, fps and multiplayer in an awesome and addicting way. first, build the maze. second, weaponize the out of it. third, let the hordes in and blast away. it is so satisfying to watch wave after wave of alien invaders succumb to your labyrinth of death. nothing like shooting one in its weakspot for the kill. and seeing your name come up at the end of the round as dps master is a nice little ego boost. i can't sing this game's praises loud enough. out of would shoot a spore pod in the face again

if you've ever wondered, what is the very worst video game ever created?? well.. 'rome ii' is worst than 'e.t. the extra-terrestrial'.. what does is 'e.t. the extra-terrestria'?? e.t. the extra-terrestrial cartridges, considered by some the worst video game ever made and blamed for contributing to the downfall of the video game industry in the s. some gamers had speculated that thousands or even millions of the unwanted cartridges made by atari were buried in a landfill in alamogordo, about miles southeast of albuquerque. the game was a design and marketing failure after it was rushed out to coincide with the release of steven spielberg s hit movie, e.t. the extra-terrestrial, and it contributed to a collapse of the video game industry in its early years. atari is believed to have been saddled with most of the million e.t. game cartridges produced. according to new york times reports at the time, the manufacturer buried the games in the new mexico desert in the middle of the night. believe me rome is worst than this

this still doesn't work on windows . edit so i caved and downloaded the fan files that make the game playable. i still do not recommend this game, though. why would anyone sell a game that takes effort to even start? as far as the gameplay goes, the intro has a unique and exciting setup. but the controls seem to be terrible with no part of the game telling you what's what. from experimenting, to pick stuff up, you click the mouse and press forward. to climb a ladder, you hold the mouse and press forward. to equip a sword, you click the mouse and press forward. compared to modern games, this is awkward and messy. hopefully the game itself will rise above its controls. i'll update more as i play. walking around trying to get favor with the old camp, i run into a bug bloodfly that one shots me. that kind of gameplay is ludicrous. nobody warned my character at all about these monsters.

this game is so boring. the voices for all the characters besides the transistor sound awful it hurts just listening to them. the bad script didn't help either. most of the time you will be walking through levels pretty much the same as the previous, coming across terminals filled with boring dialogue. the actual combat is easy. there are special 'backstage' bonus challenges to complete, but those just feel tedious. the dialogue is bad, the art is repetitive, and the combat is boring. the only good thing about this game is the soundtrack. not only that, the lead up to the different bosses is executed so poorly. i killed the st boss without realising that it was a boss. maybe it's because she looked just like everyone else or because there was no build up to the battle. the next bosses did kind of have a build up, but when the time came to finally fight them, they had committed suicide. how boring. yeah i could fight them, or i could walk in on their dead bodies. the only boss done well was the final boss.

i must saw, the story of this game is great. culturally enriching in a way that few other games are. the gameplay, however, is absolutely horrid. the game attempts to hold your hand every step of the way. unfortunately, when the hand lets go the game is brutally punishing. the camera pans in the wrong direction making it extraordinarily hard to complete a simple objective, and the 'last boss' fight is needlessly difficult. everything seems to function at a snail's pace, leaving very little up to skill. not recommended.

mass effect is an epic game in its own right. travel throughout the galaxy trying to track down saren, who wants to overthrow the galaxy. during this journey, commander shepard you will encounter friend and foe and get a few interesting companions, like liara, garrus, wrex and tali you'll also unlock new abilities and outfits. engage in interesting conversations that allow you to learn more about the universe of mass effect, and take down saren's threat by finding the mysterious conduit and figuring out why the bad guy is doing all of this. mass effect is a game with a lot of charm. i've finished the story twice and i am planning to finish it quite a few times more with different classes. it is well replayable, since there are two karma lines and each mission can be approached differently depending on how you like to play the game. it's the kind of game you shouldn't miss. a single playthrough is about hrs. replayability approx. hrs, if not more.

this just doesn't work for me. it gets past the cryptic screen, and then.. boom. error x a . i googled it, came up with nothing helpful. apparently this is a problem that happens just not to me, but to many others as well. and then after it crashed for the nth time, steam got convinced i was still playing. even though it wasn't open. i looked through the task manager, tasklist on the command promt, everything, and it wasn't open. so i now have . hours on a game i haven't spent three minutes actually playing. or one for that matter. so well done, thanks for getting my hopes up. and then smashing them into nothingness. all because of one simple error.

what the heck wus i just playing? ok, first off the good. the landscape looks wonderful. that's it. honestly. yes there are bits of some story, personal drama in the lives of people. but you can't change it, influence it, reverse it, nothing. you just witness something that unchangingly happend and you have zilch influence on the ending or on anything. the world is full of stuff, which none it you can touch or use, with the exceptions of radios and telephones which give short messages. so you just passively hear a story of stuff that happened to people, none of which gets resolved. i don't want to spoil the ending, but i can say that the ending didn't make any sense unless you like hippie new age crap. no solution, no tangible effect of you being there. it seems to be nice at first, but it drags on and on and it was way too much like a christian-hippie-kumbaya pr in my face for me to like it. i really prefer games where i bloody actually do stuff and make at least some change to this or that side.

first time around, i uninstalled the game after minutes. the animations looked stupid. i got killed instantly as always in mp fps . but people kept praising this game. when rising storm came out i gave it another try - and fell in love. turns out, it was me, who was stupid - not the game. this game makes you 'earn' your kills. and every bullet counts. make sure to take cover while reloading, unless you want to die. it does only 'one' thing, but it does it right. one of the finest shooters, you can buy. excellent sound design, voice acting and a great 'natural' flow of tactical gameplay. i rarely play multiplayer fps, but this game is an exception. the cover system feels great amp should be implemented in all games.

the first few hours, i found myself genuinely interested but that slowly dwindled away as i realized the game was the same mechanic, wash and repeat for hours. the plot was somewhat complex, which i admire, however it became incredibly absurd. at one point, the main character suddenly does something completely out-of-character and way out in left field. honestly, the facial animations are good but the face textures are just god awful that it takes away. the city feels barren, the color palette is lackluster, the npcs all seemingly have the same lines, driving from point a to point b was incredibly boring, and i could go on and on. this is a complete game, but man what a borefest. i found myself anticipating the ending so much just so i could get my closure and move on.

huge fan of konami's track and field and hyper sports arcade games. this is worse. i was able to play three events -- high jump, swimming, and m dash -- winning the third. there's no frame limiter, so it's just running at fps. crashed to desktop twice the first fifteen minutes. it isn't horrible, i'd start it up again, and at least play through every event once, but crashes kill my motivation. the bottom line is that i'd rather uninstall it than contact tech support.

i love this game . the problem is, the more arkaine try to fix the poor performance, the more they break the game and make it run worse. before i had really poor framerates and broken mouse input, then with the first beta patch they fixed the mouse and i got acceptable framerates. now i have acceptable framerates with terrible frametimes which makes the game judder like i'm operating heavy machinery whilst i'm trying to play it. it's the first time in years of gaming i've seen something so badly nauseating. it was so shockingly unplayable i asked my wife to have a look and she instantly went 'ugh!', so its not just my eyes playing tricks. i have a hz gsync monitor and the hardware to push current aaa games mostly around fps, so this isn't my hardware playing up, and i have the latest nvidia drivers installed. the problem also happens with the beta patch in place and when it's removed. i can not recommend anyone to buy this game on pc in it's current state. stay away unless you like being ripped off.
