now, portal is one of those rare games that makes its predecessor completely obsolete. there are more puzzles, more characters, better graphics and sound, more variables in the puzzles, and a surprising story that went above and beyond my expectations. unfortunately, once you ve beaten both campaigns, there s nothing left to do. even with that shortcoming, however, portal is one of the most enjoyable gaming experiences i ve had for quite a while. i'm not going to shout about how great this game is. il let you find out!

i was hoping for more from this game. a tale of a man who has taken a 'time out' from his life due to circumstances, the game suffers from up syndrome where all the best stuff is in the first ten minutes and is never matched by anything that comes after. it's a story of two people bonding over a summer, and if the game had done more with this central relationship then it might have worked. unfortunately most of this bonding is skipped over and you're plunged into a conspiracy which is really there just to give you something to react to, and which doesn't hold up to much thought. in the end it just doesn't add up to a satisfying experience. it doesn't spend enough time developing - or even give you enough scope in shaping - the relationship to work from a narrative perspective, and there's really nothing for you to do from a game perspective.
for the price this game is ok. if you want a short and sometimes frustrating diversion, then maybe buy it. for me, i would have rather not. shame there isn't a vote maybe option.

i fired this bad boy up hoping for some of the much-hyped kitschy source material with a well-rounded gameplay experience. if you release a game in , it ought to be technically superior to games years older. i felt like i was playing a croatian version of neverwinter nights . crap graphics and boring combat didn't do anything to make the expansive content palatable. i assume there was expansive content because the few missions i did went on and on and on. the first random encounters i had all played on the exact same tileset. so, basically punishment. yawn. i don't play games to give my time away generously, i pay money for first-rate interactive entertainment. anything less than that is a serious failure in this current generation of technology. plenty of shoulders for game devs to stand on -- no excuse for lack of innovation. sorry. better luck next time.

my pc has an amd fx- cpu and a r x gpu, which is a few years old and only a mid upper-mid tier card. running the game so far on 'high' with msaa off and im getting fps which i'm more than happy with since this is a brand new game running on a . year old pc. game play wise, controls feel very similar to human revolution as does the combat and all around mechanics. nothing too clunky only thing i needed to adjust was the mouse sensitivity which was very high at first launch. the new hud layout is appealing and updated along with the aug upgrade layout. the story is as engaging as ever in the deus ex series, still maintaining what i believe is a great balance of a captivating plot and player's ability to affect the plot given their in-game decisions. i haven't paid much attention to the dlc yet but i don't think they add or take away from the core experience. greatly recommend this game.

endless space a nice turned base galactic empire building strategy game. the developers have done a nice job with the mechanics and they offered new insight as the had a very transparent development process. if your a fan of more of the management and development side of strategy games i highly recommend this game. it not only lets you play the military conquest way but balances tech, culture, and diplomatic routes. user interface is really well done allowing easy navigation and displaying of informations. the ability to make custom races is nice and the the customizations of ships is great for catering vessels for your battle tactics. it has that 'just one more turn' magic that makes you wonder how it is already am.

this game has a very nice story and an incredible atmosphere, mostly due to it's very nice and classical soundtrack, but also because of the visuals. to be honest, i didn't think an rpg maker game could be made to feel this atmospheric. this game will make you think and at times might even make you cry. i definitely recommend it.

game has no fps cap, expect to be running at yes, actually four thousand frames per second and running your gpu well past c. even with nvidia d management, and precision evga fps limiters, the game uncaps itself after switching rooms. so, nothing works to limit fps. anyone who plays this game is probably clueless as to what it is doing to their computers and gpus. and that is, destroying them slowly. another excercise in poor development. do not play.

ok, so it is more like an interactive movie than a game, completely on rails with not a whole lot of choices given to you, but you know what? i'm alright with that, because the experience was well worth it regardless. if you enjoy the books and or show and want to feel like you're a part of the world, or even just want more story while you wait for your next fix, then this will definitely be a good choice. i was excited, anxious, shocked, and fearful while playing. knowing what i do about various characters and storyline already made it easy to fall into the action and have it be believable. i felt for the characters and cannot wait for the next installment to see what happens next.

great tactical space battles with all the requisite graphical effects, the ability to play as an tactical, engineering or science captain, each with varying abilities and customizable appearance with many parameters , and greatly improved and satisfying squad-based ground combat add up to one very entertaining free-to-play mmo. highly recommended.

i can't recommend killer is dead for two important reasons. the port, for one thing, is abysmal. it's locked-down, and if you're nearer to the minimum specs you'll find it hard to get playable framerates. content-wise, killer is dead is a real mixed bag. it's incredibly stylish, and interesting in it's obscure storytelling and themes. however, the gameplay is just a bit dull. it's a bare-bones hack and slash it is perfectly serviceable, but it hardly draws you in. additionally, the bizarre, juvenile 'date' missions are just repellent. unless you're a sexually frustrated teen, they are extremely offputting and downright odd, particularly given their essential nature if you hope to progress through the story at a decent rate. i wouldn't buy killer is dead, and certainly not on pc.

i really like arcade, destruction and battle racing games, but this is just sooooo boring. the demo was boring but i thought it would be better later. after a few 'races', nope, still bored to death. i think the big problem is that it's too realistic for an arcade game. cars are slow, there isn't enough 'punch' with the collisions, maybe there should be more explosions, big flames when we boost, it should be brutal but it's not. this game is as brutal as bumper cars, nothing more. so, that's the first thing that made me stop. to that i can add - the annoying commentator who seems to be as bored as me - the music ranging from 'meh' to 'dubstep' - sht than before - no interior view - ugly car designs full of sponsor stickers etc.

the division as a concept had a lot of promise but the focus on only pvp content and an unbelievable amount of bugs and exploits, have turned this game into an utter how. if it was f p it would still struggle to survive. if a competent developer publisher made this it would be a much different game, instead you can feel ubisoftitis infesting this half-broken piece of software just like all the rest of thier recent releases. how people support this company i'll never know. it's the first time they've had my money since fc and blood dragon and they'll be waiting a long time for anymore money from me.

as of feb pros -the movement feels great. rolling, jumping and jumping up things flows well. -levels are well designed. -pretty graphics. cons -only a handful of the billions of weapon configs are viable. -weapon balance is way off. prepare for grenades, rocket spam and a lot of spray and pray. -they use matchmaking instead of a server browser. -the modes are just terrible. i tried to like them. blitz is a spamfest. deathsnatch neuters long range kills. extraction is ok if your teammates bother to collect the ore. if they don't you will lose. jackhammer is just terrible. take ctf and remove all skill from it and that is jackhammer. overall out of . it has potentional though. if they add regular ctf, tdm and dm. rebalance some weapons, add a few more maps and a server browser this game would be great.

since i've first made a review, tons of dlc has been released and i've played a metric ton of this game. loved of that time, and in that time, i convinced a number of people to buy the game and play. after today, day of crimefest , i'm changing my mind. it was said before that everything unlocked during this event's challenges would be free. it has been said before that the game would never have micro-transactions. today, the company line has changed and they've made it very clear they care only for their bottom line. i know that money makes the world go round, and a company can't operate without an influx. i've bought every dlc except the latest , and i had the intentions of rectifying that today, but this broke me. i was disappointed with the failure of infamy ., but i played on. it was minor, cosmetic, and ultimately, didn't effect my play. promising one thing and then delivering what was said to never be done, i'm done. this is absurd. unless overkill changes this decision, i think they've lost another hardcore player.

a wonderful hour game with lovable characters, clever dialogue with a nice mix of jokes and seriousness, and amazing graphical design. a must-buy for any of you ace attorney fans out there. the cross-examination parts were pretty straight-forward and didn't offer that much challenge, but it didn't really matter in the end, cause for me this game was all about the character interaction and the plot. the actual gameplay parts were just a nice little extra. also the soundtrack fit nicely the theme of th century france although don't expect to hear adrenaline-pumping earworms like cornered .

painfully obvious it was a console port. controls are goofy, while you can remap them it still doesn't feel right. the camera is a constat nuisance. pov is lacking, and no map in some of the more open areas like the swamp towards the beginning are a bit frustrating. overall it kind of soured me as a fan of castlevania's original games.

great game with simple but compelling mechanics, more depth of story as you start to get into the game, and troubling moral choices that should be less fun to make. example man and his wife were political refugees of some kind, fleeing their home country. i got tasked with examining their papers. the man's papers were in order, and as he was leaving he told me his wife was behind him in line, and to be nice to her. his wife shows up, but doesn't have the proper documentation. i denied her entry because if i let her in, i'd get a citation and not get paid my own family was starving . 'why?' she pleaded. 'you've doomed me.' out of would doom her again.

difficult is an understatement.. first three levels where fun and easy to go through, but then the fourth level came.. my gun being completely useless, having to hit those damn ducks four times before they die, while in the meanwhile cannons are shooting at me. trying to wurm my way through, to find out there are some disappearing stairs at the end of the row, having birds behind my back and toads above the stairs. and don't get me wrong i did give it a lot of tries, about a , if not more.. while the other maps just took me a few tries, this one was impossible.. well.. maybe if you give it another tries frustrated, anxious, annoyed, don't buy this game unless ur some kind of gaming god or really really patient!

decay the mare is a horror psychological thriller game where you must solve puzzles like the old point and click games such as myst. well, it's more like a mixture of myst meets resident evil. it definitely plays like a classic, has a decent sountrack and the story is interesting. you play as an addict who is fighting his addiction. he takes medication one night and goes to bed only to find he is trapped in a nightmare he can not wake from. visually, the game is in d, but is static, similar to the way shadowgate is. there are some good moments where the music and the atmosphere really come together to give you an immersive horror experience. all in all, it isn't a bad game.

this game was a waste of money and time. given the developers promised the role of discovery, exploration, and adventure, they aslo promised other features. all though they are technically there within the game, the universe provided is so huge that it makes the encounter of such events and opportunities so miniscule that they might as well not have even been implimented. it would have been much better if the developers created the game on a much smaller scale so that the oppourtunity of meeting other players ingame could have happened and much more features could have been intoduced. though the game does hold future potential, it might as well been classified under false advertising as so much was promised only to be a let down for many players who wanted a little more action and less running around every twenty minutes trying to find fuel for your spacecraft.

this game looks like a really fun game, and it has great potential, but the problems are just too many to ignore. this is not like most city building games. your streets are already pre-defined and the buildings cannot be build just anywhere..only in the zones that they tell you that you can build in. the building selection is very small, and some of the buildings are glitchy at best. the transitions between water and land are unrealistic, and the maps have giant blank pieces in them. i have also experienced issues with the game crashing. i did like how once you built a building, you could add extras to the building to enhance it's influence. however, this also means that you really can't build and move on.. to maximize the effects of the buildings that you build, you need to customize every single one individually. imagine doing this for hundreds of buildings that you build. plus you need to moniter how each business is doing. this is far too much micromanaging for me. this game had some good parts, but i would recommend passing on this one.

simply put, this version is really inferior to the original doom . downgraded graphics, slower weapons, stupid little features nobody needs and small little changes that are completely unnecessary. it feels like it's a console port now. oh and if you're thinking of modding the game, forget it. the files are neatly locked away and all mod support has been dropped. even the newly added lost mission campaign wasn't that impressive and many places of the maps were taken straight from the original doom campaign, but altered slightly. if you want the real doom experience, buy a dvd copy somewhere, this one really is not worth it.

as an educational game, it's reasonably good, but the execution of the actual game part is far from flawless. i've had multiple ui bugs where the ui got stuck. there were also long periods where i had no idea what i was supposed to do or where i had to go, and i can't finish the third level, because it won't let me pick up the objective anymore and this persists . as an educational tool, i can recommend the training mode. as a game, which it definitely feels like the most, i can't recommend it.

pretty unspired and overrated. puzzles are mostly straight forward, and you can just muddle your way through most of them. rarely got that nice 'puzzlegasm' you get on a good puzzle game when you are mid-puzzle and the penny drops and you realize your current approach is all wrong, and that there's a whole other aspect to the puzzle. a well designed puzzle has a journey - from confusion, experimenting, semi-understanding, more experiementing, full-understanding. there was hardly any of that. often i felt disappointed to solve a puzzle - i was overcome with a sense of 'oh, was that it?'. buggy in parts, you and blocks can stick to walls at times. never played the original. story wasn't particularly engaging. ending was horrible. spoiler either give me the choice to not enter the pod, or just let me plunge to my death in the incinerator for a nice dark ending. my heart sank when the cheesy cut scene with your wife and the president began.

do yourself a favor and just get cave story. this game is too short and relies on a teleportation projectile for all the puzzles. which is fine, if it were of any decent length. it can't take itself very seriously. there are mixed pixel ratio issues in some areas. there's only minor enemies if you count the thwomp clones. it ramps up the challenge, but not enough to warrant someone's time or money.

probably the best puzzle-platformer that i've ever played. the ps has journey and pc has thomas was alone. it's an enjoyable platformer in which you control and freely switch between a group of different characters, who each have invidual traits that suit them to different tasks. the puzzles vary from the simple 'reach the end' type, to timed sections that often require one character to cary others and to even more creative puzzles that will challenge you to think laterally. but what makes this game the real gem that it is, is it's story-telling. the main story is told through narration that also tells individual characters thoughts at the time. there is also a 'meta-story' that is told through short pieces of text at the end of each chapter. all in all, an amazing game. well worth every penny, even if you only play it once. i've played through it twice so far and i expect that i'll play it again, the next time i want a good story told to me,mixed in with solid platforming.

great concept, but i would not recommend because of networking issues. a friend and i started out with no knowledge of the game and died instantly a dozen times in a row, but that's part of the learning. it was satisfying to progress through and figure out the crafting, and eventually we got to level with some diamondite armor before quitting. but the online play seems to always run into connectivity issues somewhere along the way. one person would start dropping through the world and not be able to see any other characters, or they couldn't be revived, or items would de-sync and duplicate. if two players pressed a portal at the same time, we would skip a zone every single time. we had to agree on who would activate portals to avoid any issues. since this game has no saves and makes it very challenging to make any progress at all, the fact that the networking breaks constantly is a huge deal-breaker. i don't consider it worth playing at all unless they decide to fix those issues.

i don't think the majority of the negative reviewers actually 'get' this game. it's not meant to be fun. it's meant to be frustrating. as someone who suffers from depression, this is probably the most accurate representation of the experience that i've seen. is it meant to be a 'good' game? no. could it have been better? yes. it's nothing fancy, and there's a few spelling errors, but i don't think there's any other legitimate criticism. it's just some dumb little game, and it does the job it set out to do. i find it unbelievable that this is what set off the gamergate mess. is it really unbelievable that someone else 'got' what this game is about and wrote a decent review? if you want to see what depression is like, play this. this is not something that's meant to be enjoyed, and that's the whole point.

i have become somewhat disinterested in regular fps games over the past several years and the last game i put a lot of time into was bf and that was only about - hrs. i knew i was going to get a vr headset and when i saw some of the content for the vive, hover junkers piqued my interest. owning a gearvr i knew that artificial locomotion character moving while you stand still can be nauseating if done poorly. when i saw that you are on a hover craft and that was what moved, i knew i had to have this game. at this point i only have a couple hours in this game due to the amazing content available for the vive, but i can say this is super fun. actually crouching behind cover to avoid getting shot is something that i never thought would actually be a thing. the only thing i can say negative about it is the current lack of content. i know there will be more content coming from the devs so it's not really a negative. i look forward to playing more and actually getting good.

quantum conundrum, while fun at first, felt like one of the longest games i've ever played. maybe that was a result of the fun quickly turning to boredom, or the lack of any semblence of a story, or something else i'm not picking up on, the result is the same tedium. if you can grab this game for under during a sale, i'd recommend it purely for john de lancie's q from star trek tng voice acting and some of the cute puzzles, but there's not enough variety here to make you feel like you've accomplished something every time you clear a room. instead of saying 'oh that was cool!' you're more likely to say 'well thank christ that's over'. some of the later puzzles are also not very well thought out and require bending of the game's rules to complete. instead of providing a solution within the parameters of the game, i had to avoid those parameters, or bend them, to get through the last leg of the game. and to think, kim swift quit her job at valve to work on this. i can't recommend it.

sarcasm it's not the greatest time waster ever. it totally isn't like i spent over nine hours on it just in the first day i owned it. sarcasm somehow this game never gets old. i've spent over a hundred hours playing deluxe and now that this is out i'm definitely going to spend at least that much time on this one. it's a classic. it's nice to see at least one good game that isn't about blowing someone up into a mess of gory bits with a gigantic gun, and is instead about something simple yet addicting like monkeys popping balloons. ninja kiwi has always been notorious for making games that are both fun and high-quality, and this is no exception to that trend. i'm glad to see it on steam, with all of the benefits having it here brings. also, i'm glad that since i had btd deluxe they gave me a copy of this version for free. some game devs could learn a thing or two from ninja kiwi about being loyal to your fanbase. love you ninjakiwi, keep up the good work. out of

pretty bad game to be honest, i hoped it'd be abetter alternative to supreme commander considering the videos of planets and moon bases, but we only managed to play a few random maps with limited orbital bodies mainly because of the insanely unoptimised ram usage meaning any sort of decent size map means all players must have gbs of ram, the graphics seem worse than other games in the same genre yet use tonnes of graphics processing, and the cost.. jesus.. biggest cons- . only race . only tech tree . expensive in cost and performance my opinion is that if you enjoy an rts and think this game might be for you, consider that everyone who plays with you must have expensive hardware and you must then wonder where all those requirements come from, it's litrally just a few small rts maps wrapped around planets, no interplanetary combat, no insane space warships, no unique races, just different looking commanders you have to pay extra for from the in game store.

i'm sorry to say that i tried several times to get this game working properly. it is so riddled with bugs it ruins any atmosphere. controls are awkward to the point of annoying. ironically the opening scene is a car crash, which not only could be a crude joke by the dev about the amount of times the game will crash, or a sublimal reference to that state of the game. it is free to play, and some people might not have had the bad experiences which i did. i feel there is something here though. the opening narrative cut scene is excellent, and gave me hope that the game was going to follow suit. i don't know if this is a work in progress. i could not review the story or plot due to the bugs and crashes. if these are sorted, then perhaps there maybe something worth playing. at the moment, though it's free, so i cannot really complain. still have to give it a down vote though.

half decent shooter, but can easily be missed. overall gameplay is too simplistic, corridor shooter at its worst. couldn't get more linear as even previously explored areas get cut off for not reason. simplistic ai, which becomes a real weakness during hunter missions as alien or as predator . marine missions incredibly basic and kinda boring. weapons feel useless and clumsy. alien missions by far the best part of the game, rather fun. predator missions underdeveloped, especially as the available arsenal and abilities are very diverse. plasma caster gets little use, first due to lack of ammo, later on due to much better weapons. really dislike the inability to break actions like taunt kills or using objects. pointless storyline, with ending that makes everything seems futile. compared to avp from made by monolith, this is a definite loser.

whatever fun there is to be had is constantly undermined pun not intended but appropriate but the incredibly frustrating, finnicky controls. the 'rewind' function present in the game is probably intended to be used when you make mistakes while you're trying to correctly dig your way round, but you'll find yourself using it just as often to take back unintended actions caused by the disconnect between your button presses and what your avatar actually does. perhaps a more patient player can stick with it but i'd prefer to spend my time mastering systems, not wrestling with input.

xenobloom does what it sets out to do well. the biggest criticism i have is that it doesn't feel as though it reaches the level of 'game.' it's more of a proof-of-concept for a ecosystem manager for a game, but by itself it's more of a simple simulator than anything. with what xenobloom offers, you get the notion that ibology set out to make the next terraria starbound with more complex flora behaviour, finished the flora behaviour code, and decided to publish that. ultimately, i think i'd get equal enjoyment out of having observational mode as a screensaver. i'd prefer to give this a neutral review if i could, but i'm required to either recommend the game or not in order to submit the review. due to feeling as though i've seen all it has to offer in the brief time i played it, i'd have to go with not. if you can spend more than an hour in things like universe sandbox, you may still enjoy xenobloom.

hey all! take it from someone who worked for s games and helped work on this game.. alot of the same issues that were there exactly one year ago to the date are still there. during my time there, there was a major focus on monetization and the priority of monetizing the game before they advertised it more and properly, because last year, barely anyone had heard of it.. and fixing bugs.. yes, they laid off the entire internal quality assurance department and focused on making money off a broken and unfinished game in lieu of finishing amp fixing regression issues.

the witcher is an amazing game. i must admit i just bought it to get into the series before playing the second and third. but boy, this is a hidden gem. i hear people complain about the combat system a lot, and it is justified. the combat is at most decent, never great but a tier about . howeveer its not the combat that makes this game brilliant, its the story. i admit that i had to endure the first three hours of the withcer, but once i got caught up in the story i wanted to go on and on. it is based on a novel after all, so the game is rich in story and characters. if you want a fast paced medieval game, look somewhere else. if you want a rich story, deep lore and good world design, the witcher enhanced edition welcomes you with open arms. i rate this, out of bacon strips note my internet were down half the time i played it, so i would ad - hours extra to what is shown

i've been gushing over this game since i started playing it. it has a strong nostalgic feel to it i grew up watching ghostbusters . would say that they do connect back to the original film, and it's a little heavy handed in the beginning and sometimes, some scenes are a little too dark to see what's going on. i haven't finished the game yet, but now after about - hours of playing, the plot is starting to get interesting. the four main characters are here and their respective actors are doing their voices. they have managed to make the virtual ghostbusters to look like their live counterparts too, which is a great bonus. graphics are a litte bit dated, due to the games age, but it's still beautiful. it's fun that you're not playing as one of them, but as a rookie taking the role that zeddmore did in the group during the original film . well worth the cost, and hey it's a great nostalgic piece of game to play. experience the original crew and bust some ghosts!

pretty damn fun open world fps that lets you approach most situations from a variety of angles. favorite gameplan stalk out post, find tiger in cage, use sniper rifle to free tiger, sit back and enjoy the show. story is entertaining enough and you get to get high on many occasions. some cool characters as well. messed with the mp for a few minutes, didn't care for it, but i really don't like any competitive fps mp anyway. tons of sidequest in the single player and lots of opportunity to just go and around. the driveing controls sucked, but they get by just barely and don't ruin too much. requires uplay, but, not once did it interfere with my game or get in the way. still would be nicer without though and some steam acheives. well worth you time.

before you say anything about my playtime, i played this game a few hours before it was released on steam through desura. if you want to have a blast, enjoy the engaging music and fun gameplay then space farmers is really for you. it is a co-op game so invite a friend. as the developers said you pay for copies of the game. one for you and one for your most trusted or troll friend. you are in for a blast. jetpacks, cookie machines, dinossaurs, bulls, massive grinders trying to mince you into pieces, cows that if 'stimulated' will turn their bums into a incinerator.. and much much more. its been a while since i had so much fun. you can 'troll' and be 'trolled' not only by your friend..but also by the game. believe me when i say you that the game can 'troll' you on the most particular and awesome ways. what can i say? i love it and everytime i log in i am in a great gaming session.

great game with beautiful atmospheric graphics. the voice acting is way above par and the storyline is as good as any comic based game or movie can possibly offer. there's extra side challenges you can do to extend the length of the game such as collecting riddles or finding interviews of the inmates, but overall looks like the game shouldn't take much longer than hours to beat if you play it straight through. the animation is very smooth and fluid and the action makes you really feel like you're kicking some . some may find this a little too streamlined, but upgrade the difficulty level and you'll learn quick that you can have full control of the action rather than button mashing to win the fight. good mixture of stealth action, puzzles, and adventure. great game!

i didn't even last an hour with this game. i can see the appeal for some people, but i really wish i hadn't spent so much on it. pros - cyper layout is awesome - basic game concept cons - no proper tutorial? it took me forever to find the headquarters, and then even longer to find a bank to get a loan. - the controls are tedious if i had played the game for longer i would proberly have more to say. but i just can't force myself to open it again.

i've given this game a lot of thought and playthough and decided that i cannot recommend this even though the gameplay is quite original and i like supporting indie devs. long story short unique take on an asteroid shooter - avoding asteroids without really shooting much, main mission is to collect orbs decent enough for a few hours of playthrough a day the rpg elements and the upgrade system are good, but may have been added only to increase playtime -clunky controls and only partial support -repetitive music, mediocre sound and somewhat poor voice acting -trailer makes a lot of bold claims like 'phenomenal graphics' which are simply not true -the gameplay is very rudimentary and gets boring fast -not that many missions available all in all, this would be worth getting for the trading cards and to maybe try something new, but don't expect to play this long term

the ai is bad and unbalanced. an enemy will see his teammate get shot right next to him but remain right next to him, or he will see a shot land right in front him but continue reloading out in the open, not even making an attempt to hide behind cover. they will also ignore the extremely obvious claymore mines that you can place, and will walk into trip wires even if they see you place them. at the same time, ai that do spot you somehow have pinpoint accuracy from meters away with a pistol or smg. additionally, sniping an enemy immediately alerts all the other enemies to your exact location. granted, the sniper rifles are not silent and the dead bodies are obvioius, but the ai should not be able to pinpoint my location from m away just from the sound of a sniper rifle being fired and shoot at me with pinpoint accuracy from that distance, even when i am behind a wall.

along with enemy within, it's hard to ask for more out of a small scale turn-based tactical game. make sure to get both of them, and be sure to at least play on classic mode. xcom is more about turn-based battle tactics than strategy, with the strategy element coming in the form of micromanaging your hq and all resources. but everything is logical, the battles are perfect and amazingly rewarding. ai is outstanding there is no synthetic difficulty to be found in this game. xcom enemy unknown is very easy to play due to the perfect ui and minimalist controls you can play entirely with the mouse , yet it is very challenging purely due to the tactics required to succeed at battles. furthermore, this game is extremely polished. so it is an all around incredible experience, highly recommended.

good idea for a game but balance is horrible. like most table top games it has units that are over powering unless countered with the same type of units. trouble is unlike table top games this game has no concept of mass combat one unit fighting multipe units at once . there seems to be bonuses to units if you surround them but either they are way to small or don't actually work. the different factions are seriously unbalanced. wolves get double attacks and triple counters but still have etremely high health compared to other factions. holy factions get strong heals and improved accuracy. undead get debuffs that take three turns to power up and unit costs as high as the other so there is no way to offset their poor accuarcy by fielding more units than the enemy. all in all the game shows promise but balancing issues must be addressed before they even think of getting out of beta.

i really thought im gonna love this game, but turns out i dont. played about hrs singleplayer and the feel of the game is that of an mmorpg without the mmo. so what is left is a very clunky and unbelievable shooter. enemies respawn after a area got cleared which makes returning to said area for a quest a real chore. the weapons are, well too plentyful. i never got to really get attached to a gun because a replacement was just minutes away. the iron sights for the guns are aweful. the gunplay itself also feels lightweight, guns have no real heft to them. the design of the guns is also..well i dont like it. the cell shading is also not helping the game. all in all the quests are boring. story might be interesting but its hard to notice when hordes of noisy enemies drown out any sort of dialoge. people commend the humor of the game but for me personally there was in hrs not even one chuckle ..not one. humor is subjective so i wont judge it on that. but in all i was mostly bored with this game.

purely kinetic visual novel. i'd love to say it has a great story but i can't. a good of it boils down to brief descriptions of some mountains paths in china with wikipedia hyperlinks. there is also some very barebones plot that is nothing more than a girl showing another girl around the area with a brief stop to get tea. it takes about minutes i'd guess if you're a slow reader to go from start to finish. there is also some very bad voice acting thrown in. it just sounds so bland and uninspired. on the plus side some of the artwork is nice but that's about all the praise i can give it unfortunately.

i gave this about two hours, enough time to justify saying 'i gave it a fair go.' it was fine. the aesthetic is a lot like borderlands, though borderlands feels much more like an alien wasteland that i get to actually explore. the enemies are a lot like enemies from borderlands, but in borderlands, there's a sort of satisfaction to be found in the way my attacks actually seem to injure my enemies. it was fine. the game ran, i shot some things, and it kept me diverted for about two hours, but it didn't have the depth of feeling i suppose i was hoping for. it felt like i was going through the motions of being a massively-armored space marine guy i never thought i'd really say i was 'going through the motions' about something like that.

i just bought this game and so far i've put quite a few hours in to it and i'm only getting started really. this game is exactly what the city builder genre needed and it's the game i've been looking for, for a long time now. it's clever and brilliantly executed. the survival aspect of it works surprisingly well and doesn't take away from the game in any way. keep in mind, it is not easy. you will find yourself failing and things going wrong. so far i've gone through four different towns but it's still a lot of fun. i love it and would recommend it to anyone thinking of giving it a try.

after looking over the options, i decided i really didn't want to jump straight into one of the various combat game modes. i instead opted to create a singleplayer world to test the limits of building. once i had done so, i realized several things in succession. . worlds in this game are tiny. like, you have more room to run around on a tf map. you could easily make the entire world a single building, especially since the game is basically in minecraft creative mode by default and there are no hazards except for other players. . there are no singleplayer worlds. it's multiplayer, full stop. . most of the people who play this game are eight-year-old russian kids. . with microphones. . there's no way to mute the microphones. . i don't remember how this game got in my library. after that i went to stay with some relatives for a few days. i think i'm safe now.

i had some trouble getting my controller to work at first, but after i figured out the problem it was smooth sailing. it's a very well optimized port, i get a constant frames per second at the highest settings possible at p with a i - k cpu and gtx card. it looks amazing, too, definitely some of the best graphics i've seen from a console port. as for the game itself, the main mission is pretty short, but there are a few more missions to do afterwards. the gameplay is amazing, by far the best in the series. overall if you're a big metal gear solid fan, this is an absolute must play game if you want even a taste of next year's phantom pain.

rocket league is a fun game to play with friends online as a team and get some goals or saves. cant wait for later updates updated review game is still fun to play and im getting better at the game step at a time. connections to the server is good at ms ping but sometimes goes over ms which makes it a little hard to play but still playable. i reccomend this to anyone who likes cars and soccer. its reccomened to use a controller but i use both keyboard and controller. its best to play with friends so you can have a better team that you can talk to using a mic. i will be recording this sometime to upload to youtube d in conclusion i give this game a thumbs up edit i have bought all the dlcs so far and they are all worth buying if you got spare money p.s if you found this review helpful give it a thumbs up so otthers can see this review p this is still an amazing game

i can't wax lyrical about this game like i have other indie games, i mean the gameplay is kind of slow, i doubt there is too much replay ability. yet despite this i would class this 'fall out esque' game a ill steam gem, something which is undoubtable overlooked in favour of other games, yet still deserves the attention it can get. positives interesting story, nice graphics decent text, none of that cheesy poor grammar 'stuff' which can plague other indie games. awesome map, the way the character traverses the world and all the instances are pretty well managed. con combat is repetitive, not really a way to change that, but then it does make the other gameplay more enjoyable. character walks slowly, however this is merely a petty comment which is also redundant as you can change character speed.. conclusion well worth a buy, if it s in the sale, definitely get it, if not.. then unless you want to write a positive review hold your horses and think before you buy.. but as long as you think you do want to buy it. it s pretty damn fun! edit spelling mistakes

my computer screen keeps flashing, likes swithcing between a black screen and the game at a very high frequency. i tried update my video card driver to the latest, close all background applications, i still can get rid of this issue. this problem cause this game unplayable. i am using gtx m as primary graphic card and hd as secondary adaptor, should be very common among notebooks. they should have test on some common specs before release this half done product. postscript by changing the 'display mode' value from '' to '', manually from a xml file in game setting folder, i can access the game in borderless window mode now.. but the framerate was awful. considering my graphic card is lower than gtx in performance, the framerate maybe reasonable. i guess most notebook with a video card below gtx m would have the same performance issue with this game..

there's not a lot of good things i can say about this game, i was looking forward to playing it as i love retro games, and i just feel majorly dissapointed. i find the game incredibly hard to grasp, i am not sure what my heroes are supposed to do and i keep getting lost in the very samey looking town. good soundtrack is nice option to let the computer handle the fights for you. bad - there are no tooltips for the options in the game, so you have to resort to the manual. - alt tab to check manual makes the playwindow so tiny you can barely see anything. - the game lags horribly after just - minutes of gameplay. the music skips and overall the whole computer seems to lag from the game. - first time playing you can't skip the intro story.

my opinion on magical diary is mixed. on the one hand i had fun on my first playthrough. i wanted to see where the story was going. the rpg aspect skills to grow mainly seemed interesting. on the other hand after having finished the game twice, it seems that no matter what skills you choose to improve or how bad you do at the several exams , you can always finish the game, and it doesn t change the story much. replayability is compromised by having to re-read everything or almost everything, or risking missing some new original developments in the story when you ve taken different decisions in the past. if you enable to option to fast-forward then the game will not stop on new text that you haven t read in your previous playthrough. still it was a nice experience the first time, so if you re not afraid of reading relationships magic stuff the game, in retrospect, is more a visual novel than an rpg and can get it on sale for cheap, then you could do worse than trying it.

the concept of this game is brilliant. unfortunately, the same can't be said about the execution. sound design, quality, physics, enemies - just about anything that makes or breaks a game, you can bet your bottom dollar that this game messed it up! half the time, all of the blocks in the world are entirely transparent! in fact, this game is so bad that it's not even worth going through all the problems with it, please, for your own sake - stay well away from this game. this game is the definition of a bad minecraft clone. seriously, steer clear of this game.

windows fix and . first open up the fallouta default.ini file in steamapps common fallout find the line busethreadedai change it to busethreadedai add another line after it and insert inumhwthreads then download the games client from after installing the client, set compatability mode to windows vista sp finally download the d d .dll file from and place the file in your fallout folder haven't had a single crash since doing this, and its been running smoothly. tweak as needed

call of duty ghosts is yet another title in an yearly cycle of cod games. infinity ward this time have created a semi futuristic game with new graphics, and a more inovative muiltplayer. the customisation avaliable in muiltplayer is truely surpurb best for a cod game yet with new weapons, the ability to play as a girl for the first time, and brand new weapons never seen before. the maps are a true return to form for cod with larger maps allowing for more explorations, and the new dynamic features are also quite exciting. the campaign is average, but is still good if your a cod buff who plays the campaign before jumping into the muiltplayer. extinction is an interesting change up, and although it will probably most likely never reach the heights of zombies, it is a fun change up, with plenty of fun to be found in the single map that is currently being offered. rating out of terrible pc port can go and rek itself

i play games with a controller on my tv, almost exclusively. with that setup, heavy bullets made me motion sick. that never happens to me. i think it's caused by the combination of poorly calibrated controller controls the acceleration curve is very poorly mapped to the left analog stick, and aiming with the right stick feels completely off , the very wide fov, and the extremely fast maximum running speed. i love the idea, and i love the style and music, but heavy bullets is, for me, unplayable. if you play games with a mouse and keyboard on a monitor rather than a tv, your experience will probably be different from mine, but i cannot recommend heavy bullets in its current form with my setup. this is my first negative steam review and it makes me very sad to post it, but i'd prefer to be honest.

the protagonist is exceptionally flat and boring, relying on special snowflake backstory and aesthetics to seem cool. combat is rps where every enemy keeps throwing rock tacked on to a rythm game. the best worldbuilding can't save a game if if focuses on a boring protagonist and lazy gameplay that eat up of the gametime. i finally tried this game after hearing so much hype for it and i honestly can't understand why. were the other games so much better that this one got praise retroactively? or are people just willing to overlook poor mechanics and characters for the sake of pixel tiddies? at least, that's my opinion. not like anyone's going to read the reviews for an eight-year-old game.

do.. not.. buy.. even at off.. you will never see those dollars again this game had been hyped as a tactical fps that was supposed to satisfy the rainbow six itch that many of us have been feeling lately. the problem? this game is worse in every conceivable way to even rainbow six raven shield which was released a full decade ago. seriously, just bust out raven shield or vegas again with your friends instead of buying this. the graphics, gun selection, hit detection, enemy ai, friendly ai, sound effects, menus, functionality crashes bugs , and generally just the playability of this game is all awful. the only thing that was up to snuff was decent map design.. but that doesn't help much when every single aspect of the game going on inside those maps is terrible.

my rating out of replayability yes achievements multiplayer no what is this game about? this is a base jumping simulator where players earn points for performing tricks across eighty unique levels. there are seven achievements with their own varying difficulty to attain. the only involvement with other players is the leaderboard. storyline is told through in the level selection by the stoner radio host. in the level selection there are options you can choose that either tell you facts or show acid-trip cinematics with odd stories. is it fun? yes, the game will keep you busy for hours, but doing the same tricks on various layouts of levels will get old.

playing this game makes me think of dante's inferno the poem, not that crappy gow video game . it jokes around the idea of a hell on earth with a cocky hero cracking jokes, while invoking imagery of demonized day-to-day activities such as watching the news, drinking soda and working at a corporate monstrosity. if you're a fan of the original, then the combat is still here, but dante is more crass than you remember him. a quality which i think makes him more believable as a comic personality, like deadpool meets spiderman. i can only hope that this re-imagining of the series garners enough of a fan-base to warrant a sequel, as seeing the actual devil may cry business starting up would be a delight for me.

i cannot recommend this game because of its high learning curve and large amounts of random gameplay elements. the high learning curve is not a matter of difficulty it is a matter of inadequate documentation. when starting this game, you are given very little information about the actual gameplay. the 'tutorial' assumes you already know how character movement is accomplished, what the icons on your screen mean, and what gameplay jargon means. for example, the game continues to warn you about 'courage' but never tells you which of the meters bars counts on the overly complicated ui represents courage. the other major problem with this game is the amount of guessing required. in minesweeper, you have enough clues to figure out the location of the mines. this is like minesweeper in a tunnel with two different types of mines and no way to mark any of the mines.

a fun timekiller that need some knowledge about ancient 'game of life'. when you first time start the game you simply don't know what to do, you just add breathe of life into the field, and the blocks are starting blinking, generate patterns of life, plants only survive when it get breathe of life, and sometimes they mutate and you get a new spicies of plant. it sounds simple but there're many thing you need to consider, and simetimes a event can change many conditions. however this game doesn't give you stress like other games, you just put life in, watch what happens. if you just don't have time, you can enter observation mode and just watch what happens. it's relaxing and beautiful if you managed to play it well.

runetone keeper is one of those titles that aren't worth the full price and since there is no neutral vote, i have to not reccomend it. grab it for half price or less and it'll be nice game to spend couple of hours. as description says it's quite classic roguelike, not very complex, but still hard with rng ragequits.story while interesting is a bit basic and hard to follow due to random popups with part of it. music and sound is very basic. replayability is good, quite few classes, some unlocks and hidden bosses to grind for. sadly game is still quite unbalanced some weapons items are just useless and since it seems not developed anymore and doesn't have mods, you'll have to stick with vanilla and it's quirks.

coupled with left dead and with all of the downloadable packs included too, this is certainly worth the value in buying. this game also has longevity it's still being played many years after it's release and a great way to bring friends together over the internet. the game is fast-paced, it forces you to think and act on your toes to defeat the nefarious special infected which now include the charger, jockey, and spitter, along with many varieties of special common infected. the subtle undercurrent of tactics to fast paced shooting really helps this stick out among the -loads of zombie shooters out there. not to mention the addition of memorable characters such as the jolly, food-obsessed coach, mischievous redneck ellis, and snide mobster nick, and i guess rochelle too.. be sure to play this. it is a blast.

it was clear what i had to do the moment i realized i could create my own empire, and after some quick tweaking, i'd created a universe where the united states had taken over earth in the name of god and glorious arms death to commies m , and was now ready to expand throughout the galaxy. with my research ship, the u.s.s. enterprise, and it's captain, tiberius kirk, we were ready to boldly go where no man has gone before in this final frontier. we discovered many anomolies, life-bearing planets, organic space-faring crystals, galactic jellyfish, and even signs of a precurser race, all while building the foundations that would make america great again nay, for it is already great, we were just making it better. now if only fernando martinez, political activist and candidate for consul, could please stop running in the elections on the platform of legalizing slavery to 'preserve our way of life.' imagine a world where sword of the stars ii didn't suck, that's stellaris.

amazing lightsaber simulator, and probably my favorite game on the vive disclaimer, i'm a huge star wars fan . it is so fun finally feeling like a saber-weilding jedi. the game itself is simple but sooo fun in its main level, deflect lasers shot at you from a floating spherical droid that moves around in a corridor infront of you think luke in a new hope training on the millenium falcon, but you can see . there are varying difficulty levels, the hardest of which is actually quite difficult. i usually put one of the vive controllers on the floor and play with only one saber. i also make sure my star wars spotify playlist is blasting before i step into vr on this one haha. the bonus desert temple level is amazing! if you thought the original game was fun, wait till you try that. would recommend to anyone with a vive. i usually show this to my friends as one of their first vr experiences. also endless replay value for those wanting to hone their lightsaber skills for the inevitable day when ben kenobi arrives at their door.

hours in and im uninstalling this single player mmo, this is no gothic game. even the massively buggy gothic at least had a fun open world to explore. this is just a series of locked zones you move around in looking for random fetch quests and hidden items of the same type to unlock high level gear late game. lack of classic gothic skill up and stats have been replaced with a sterile point buy system. the crafting interface is well done but it amounts to mass producing buff and healing potions. all the gear is incredibly static and leveled. you find a massive two hander then later you find a crude club that has more damage on it as an early upgrade till you find a new two handed sword with higher damage. skip this one and play risen. its much more involved and has higher production values. though i gotta say arcania has great graphics and looks fantastic.

binding of isaac is as incredible as it is simple. you can run in four directions and you can shoot in four directions. however the replayability as over hours playtime on my account proof is unimaginable. wanting to rerun the game and always thinking that it could still get better keeps one playing the game. the graphics surely are a matter of taste. they have a nice cartoony look but still is quite gory at the same time. the music is great. for a game that you're probably going to play for countless hours you need a fitting music that doesn't make you want to cut your ears off. and the melodies in this game surely manage to avoid that unpleasant incident. they are almost kind of subtle and somehow manage to be catchy at the same time. the controls, again, are really simple but fit the game since you really only can run, shoot and use some items. so in my opinion a simple 'yes' doesn't quite fit this game. i would rather go for 'hell-a doodle yeah' or something similar in meaning.

hook is a short, simplistic, minimal puzzle game. the objective is more or less to remove certain hooks in a specific order without colliding with other hooks in the process. very simple in concept, but this game plays surprisingly well, i enjoyed my time with it. some puzzles are much easier than others, the first for example can be completed in mere seconds, but as the levels go on, you will notice the rise in difficulty as you begin contemplating every move you make more and more carefully. the simplistic and atmospheric music is a very nice touch too and fits the theme of the game. for the sake of the standard asking price being ., i would definitely recommend this game to puzzle fans. i would write more regarding the game itself, but there honestly isn't much else to say. it's short, simple, sweet and deserving of a sequel.

first off, this game is beautiful. playing on a gtx , i can run everything on full except aa with about fps. that should how well optimised this game is, as i can tell you that the graphics' are akin to sw battlefront's. then there is the gameplay. depending on how you want it, project cars can be more like an arcade racing simulator or an actual drive around a race course. it's has it's 'wow' moments, especially when you've finally completed a difficult track without any scuffs. the game works very well with the controller, for those of you who don't have a steering wheel. two problems though 'where do i start!' beginning can be quite difficult, and the tutorials are a bit slow and annoying. i recommend jumping into career mode and doing phase . there are those qualifying rounds which are hella slow. i mean, i just want to jump into a fun race, not drive around endlessly trying to get a fast lap time! overall out of . a very, very fun simulator once you get into it.

this game basically takes the premise of no man's sky and blends it brilliantly with the gameplay of terraria. while i'm not a huge fan of survival games terarria is literally the only other survival game i've bothered playing , the space travel and planet-to-planet environment variety makes this game great fun. the plot of the game is somewhat lacking, but i've had far more than my fill of entertainment contstructing farms and friends in multiplayer. this is a definite reccomendation for anyone who likes terraria or minecraft-esque survival games, with solid content for both adventurers and builders alike. however, it is quite cpu bound. i would reccomend you stay away if you're running an amd chip- i friend of mine running on a fx- often suffers from terrible frame drops when it rains. if you're running fast dual core or a quad core intel cpu, you should be fine.

tl dr it's not a bad game, but you should think carefully about whether or not you are the target audience. on paper, spacechem sounds exactly like my kind of game. it's a playful take on concurrent programming, and on top of that, it's themed around chemistry. i like puzzle games. i like programming. i like chemistry. surely i will like spacechem then, right? unfortunately not. i tried really hard to enjoy this game, but each time i play, a very distinctly nagging feeling hit me i could just be programming. the game isn't bad in any notable way, and i actually had some fun playing it. but i just have so much more fun actually programming. this will be a 'buyers beware' to the kind of people that get irritable during handhold-y tutorials and on-rails games. spacechem is a game. not a sandbox. this game boils programming down to two concepts solving the problem, and optimizing your solution. there is going to be one single 'best' solution to the problem at hand, and your solution is going to be either optimal or sub-optimal. end of story. here is why you will probably like this game

the first game i won from steamgifts, for free, so not entirely sure. the story itself is kind of fun, the quality of the game is good, no major wrap ups, then why isn't it marked recommended? well, simply said, a few small things do tend to feel act strange. - having to fill a bucket with water different times or so, only to destroy them when you find the place that you need a bucket of water why don't you keep the first bucket, for future use? - having to go back, because suddenly a search spot has something but before, it wasn't there? - hundreds of undead pirates bound by oaths, but barely any on the island - story makes the game fun once, but you need probably run throughs to finish the achievements as said before, most of the boxes of the game are ticked, it's fun, lighthearted, not too dark, not too easy, and keeps you captivated, but this is the time i needed to find all the achievements.. so, if you see it on a decent price off, or on steamgifts, it is worth your time, just not at full price unfortunately..

ftl has been one of the most interesting pick up games i've ever played. due to my current job and location, i can't just get on skyrim or on an mmo for long periods of time. so a quick pick up game would be ftl. its a great little story telling pick your own destination adventure in space! while many people are big into tf 's hat idea, this game i get to work and earn towards different ships that all vary in one means or another. i'm not a big fan of using robots, so i learned how to defend against people with robots. sometimes i'm really geared to fighting with robots and automations, so we got a ship or two built for exactly that. there is plently of possible combinations of in game content within the story line that makes the whole trip of traveling across expanses of space a fun and exhilirating when you got a massive enemy armada just a few steps behind you. i really recommend this game to anyone who is into space games, adventuring, pseudo-role playing, or anything in between.

pretty though it is, as a roguelike, shattered planet should be judged primarily by its gameplay, which is sadly lacking. you can equip only one weapon and one piece of armor, plus whatever consumables you can find and you won't find many . there's no concept of activated or even passive skills, either gaining experience buys you stat increases only. as such, combat - and the game in general - is nearly devoid of strategy, infrequently rising above mindless clicking.

ubisoft, you sly devil you. i gave you dollars and you handed me a piece of trash. just to be constructive i will give some pros and cons. pros beautiful game as far as environments and architecture goes. heavy character customization. ubisoft finally cracked the code! no one likes playing outside the animus, instead they just give you some short narrated cutscenes inbetween chapters. cons very unlikable main character with predictable motives. side characters are boring compared to black flag. controls are extremely twitchy. with the game being far more stealth oriented than previous games, this is a major hinderance. certain parts of the game are only accessable online, so if you have a bad internet connection you are really missing out on a lot of content. you'd think a game with such a successful pedigree would of been more quality. out of i'm retiring my hidden blades for good this time.

there are lots of positive things about this game, but overall i wouldn't recommend it. the puzzles are fairly simple, it's a gentle game and the overall length is very short. all of these could be positives but there's far too much time spent watching your character walk slowly across the landscape, knowing full well what you're going to do when he finally gets there. the overall graphic style is beautiful, but the way some elements of movement and interaction are handled doesn't feel as strong as the basic page turn pop up effect. the music is ok and adds to the atmosphere, but occasionally cuts out abruptly, which is jarring. definitely worth picking up if it's on sale, but i almost felt like i got most of the enjoyment out of this by watching the trailer.

this game is simply a is great. it might be a few years old, but the ambiance and scares are well done. this is scary on so many levels. the enemies are creepy, sound design is genious and the camera light night shot combined with constant need to recharge makes for a chilling experience. you will yell.you will be scared. this game is still very good and relevant to prepare you for the second game coming soon! my biggest complain is that after facing the same ennemy a few time, it get a little easier to fool their pattern making it easier. but yet, i have not played on hard. the game is also pretty short around hours but playing the dlc is well worth it too and last about more hours and some insight on how everything started. i recommend watching my video ''outlast in a nutshell rest in pieces''. it is a very funny edit of my full h playthrough condensed in under minutes with only the best scares, story moments and many funny edits! just be wary of spoilers!

borderlands is a open world multiplayer shoot and loot game where you can take on one of four classes if you have dlc . you start out the game wondering where the you are and trying to get off the glacier with claptrap. as the game progresses you start to find out more of pandora's history through little echo communicators. you can find history on handsome jack, roland, claptrap and the rest of the crew. gameplay wise you will not be bored because there are lot's of side content to keep you busy for hours apon hours. but what will take most of you're time is legendary farming. trying to get every legendary is tough but worth it. if you plan on legendary farming take a couple of friends!! it helps..trust me.. would i recommend this game to new commers of this shoot and loot series? yes!! the first boderlands didn't have much story except gun p rn everytime you load up a new area. so treasure hunters would you like to hear another story heh? well if not to bad i'm telling it anyway.

do not buy this. i don't understand how this is still sold. it does not work on windows and apparently on other versions too . many asked online for help, and no solution has been found yet. i contacted rockstar games support and they ignored me. what happens you install the game and spend - minutes to fix graphic problems, reinstalling missing or old files, giving launch commands on steam and making a social club account etc. no matter what you do, this game will crash as soon as you start the game or for some others, apparently a couple of minutes into the game gta iv fatal error wtv gta iv fatalerror windowstimerfunctionsvalidator check -readfromprotectedbuffer qpcfailed! - either reboot or reinstall gme for windows live obviously, rebooting or reinstalling game for windows live doesn't work. this is a scam, the product is impossible to use, many had this problem and we are being ignored. do not waste money.

l.a. noire is a great game that really nails the detective cop theme. although it isn't a very long game it has a lot of great twists and exciting moments that thicken the plot to the very end. i definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for an awsome single player experience.

one of my favourite games to date, if not my favourite ever. dragon age origins allows you to make decisions and interact with npcs and party members in a way that can get you truly attached to their stories. there are so many tales woven into one wonderful, complete and complex campaign which you can, to a fair extent, influence through your decisions. the combat system is very simple to learn but still can be manipulated to fit your style, and you can make this game as challenging or leisurely as you like it. not only can i appraise the obvious, but i can also comfortably say that the attention to detail in this game, right down to the little things like the designs on the armour sets, is set to a very high standard. it's abundantly clear how much work was poured into this game. the only flaw i could accentuate would be that the dungeon crawling does get a tad repetitive, but it's necessary, so if you can forsake a hard. gruelling dungeon crawl and you're willing to give up many, many hours of your life, this game comes with my strongest recommendation.

this game is a first person melee game and also the pc port of a console game with all the ups and downds console games have . it plays best with a controler, but mouse keyboard are supported too. the story is mostly linear. aside from a few clearly defined sneak battle places, the player always has the choice to use a sneaky approach or to go in flashing combos, or a combination of those. there is no character development, aside from unlocking new combos and better magic using money. the larger ambushes and sieges have a nicely realized scale with lots of allies foes and the character tipping the scales. the story is strongly anchored in the norse myths and includes a lot of spoken dialog and videos.

can't say i recommend this game. what may pass itself off as fun fps randomness ends up coming out as an unbalanced fps with the dino gimmick only lasting as long as your patience with the game itself. the classes are creative enough but the fun doesn't last when the servers are full of salty little kids who after every single double suicide death make damn sure to type in chat 'xd totally worth it!' or 'worth' that being said you can have some real fun in this game with friends in a server but its not something i would want to revist on my own and playing with friends did get boring after a while. go pick up fist full of frags instead, the game has much more replay value and it doesn't rely on gimmicks and classes to lure players in. or you could ignore all of this and buy it anyways, because jesus look at how many cigars churchill has in his mouth! what a legend!

and now for my after-completion mini-review for pillars of eternity. i've never played infinity engine games back in the day. it still hit me that poe is one of the greatest isometric rpgs in years. the story, the characters durance ftw! , the quests, the music, all full of epicness. the combat was not as fun as in e.g. divinity original sin, another kickstarter triumph, in tactical sense, but it was interesting enough. little minus for having only some parts of the texts spoken, even inside single conversations. good hours with all side quests done, it did not get tiring at all but had me hooked all the way. quality entertainment. kudos, obsidian! out of

so i'm adventuring around, killing zombies in kf and blowing up cowboys in fist full of frags, when suddenly an urge envelops me. i desire a game where i control miniature goblins guarded by a giant troll, that can get two shot by a minotaur leader. in all seriousness, this is a really fun, really interesting game that reminds me a lot of the old black and white games. it's nowhere near as indepth or having the same mechanics, but the feeling of looking after your little goblins by controlling this big troll is just nostalgic as hell. i do have a few gripes with the game the control methods are a bit clunky, the ui could be better designed and the goblin management could be far better than slider bars. but all in all, it's still incredible. if this was a paid for game, i'd give all my money. please keep improving this, or at least make a sequel! d just don't fall into micro transaction hell and i'll love you forever.

the orange box, or perhaps half life itself, is the greatest value in all of gaming history. why? because with just hl you unlock the ability to literally play thousands of free mods, some of which are of higher quality or more fun than hl itself, as well as the tools to make your own mods and maps. if you haven't played hl and are worried about hl , don't. the story is just as bizarre as ever and the token 'unexplainable ending' of all half life games has returned yet again.

pretty grounded in reality compared to later saints row games. unfortunately, this instalment, before the updated engine of sriii has aged very badly. on top of that, the pc port is pathetic. terrible frame rate my ti should have been more than enough to handle it objects floating away from eachother in every cutscene with some pretty funny results. none of it makes the game unplayable outside of a few mission failures due to your target getting stuck in a wall or something. ignoring performance and technical prowess, the cars handle well, but the game's really bad at conveying your next objectives putting a tiny marker on the world map and expecting to instinctively know to look for it and know what it means and the game arbitrarily gates off each story mission until you've filled a gauge which you can only fill by completing repetive side missions which start of entertaining but get old very quickly. not a terrible experience, but i gave up on it when i was tasked with a madatory story mission involving flying through hoops in a time limit using a helicopter, and no this game's helicopter controls are a joke.

'i first met davey wreden at a writing workshop in college. he seemed like a cool guy, and he wanted to be my friend. he kept bugging me to let him read the novel i was working on, so i did. a month or two later i found out he showed it to all his friends without my permission. i even found out he altered my novel to include some stupid painting. i told him to never talk to me again, and i vowed to never finish the novel. six months later i found out this scumbag published my novel in an atempt to 'apologize' to me for showing everyone my novel. what the f k?' oscar wilde, author of dorian gray's day off original title . the story

this is one of the strangest games i have ever played. and i've been playing since '. it's a slot machine board game life simulator mash up. and if that right there doesn't get your attention, what will? this isn't an action packed game by any means it's a thoughtful, transcendant journey. sometimes you'll feel like you're not getting anywhere. and then you'll play a game where you unlock the mysteries of life. if you're anything like me, you'll constantly be wondering 'what in the world inspired these people to make this game and oh my goodness would they please make more games'! highly recommended if you like quirky games.

out of update a new patch has been release that addressed a lot of balance issues! yippy! i suggest reading the patch notes on the news page to find out more. this great game is back on track d to those that played ns it is what combat should have been if it was in ns from the start! it is fairly well balanced, and includes some fun upgrades from extra levels. to those who never played ns this is a team fps game. sorta moba style were the point is to push into the enemy base and kill there cc hive. you must work as a team to complete this task. but, unlike ns vanilla you dont have a commander that chooses your upgrades and dictates the path your team takes, each idividual player gets to pick there own upgrades as they level up during the round. honestly i cant do it justice in trying to discribe it! simply put this is a fun, fast paced, action packed game, and i strongly suggest you pick it up and play!

i don't often play indie games, but the swapper is a great demonstration of why you should. the core 'swapping' mechanic is used to create an excellent assortment of challenging environment puzzles. the narrative's philosophical questions are a perfect compliment to the gameplay, although i was playing more to try to get the next orb rather than to find out where the story would go next. the visuals and audio, although lacking in range, nail the isolated space station feel perfectly. overall, a great few hours of space-themed gameplay that will rack your brain and deliver a sense of satisfaction for every small success.

pros big sandbox adventure with super powers, guns, spaceships, and cars tons of content, very high replayability easy to learn controls and user-friendly ui unique, loveable characters hilarious dialogue interesting story and lore that connects this game all the way back to the first sr. no you don't need to have played any of the previous games to enjoy this one, but if you do want to go back start at the second or third tons of good music and radio stations lots of customization options for your character, your weapons, your crew and your vehicles. a bunch of different mini-games multiplayer is just as fun and functional as solo professor genki and the genki girls cons - i didn't care for the fact that after you beat the story, the main gameplay is stll in the vr machine. i had a blast with the super powers and everything but it all felt worthless because it was virtual and my hero wasn't getting any stronger irl. this is like gta, if gta was more fun and less edgy..and on ecstasy.

think of futuristic battlefield. really thats what is basically is but with much more people on a single server. ps is not in anyway a generic mmofps shooter, its unique in its own way. alerts events help with replayability and the progression is nice and slow but it doesn't feel grindy at all. you can play by yourself and still have fun, but when you have a platoon full of people it can get quite hilarious and chaotic! pros -visuals are quite nice. -awesome dev interaction with players. -not pay win. -classes are nice and balanced. -weapons feel like they have power. -the sound in this game is quite amazing. cons -vehicles feels somewhat clunky to me.
